Shipco Transport Inc., a leading international cargo transportation company, has an immediate opening at our Hoboken branch located in Hoboken, NJ for an experienced IT Junior Helpdesk Support.
 KEY TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 
 Provide telephone and deskside support for all desktop systems distributed by Shipco’s I.T. department.
  Troubleshoot and research problems where a resolution is unknown. This may require speaking to a client, searching online databases, software help files or other sources that are available.
  Create, escalate, and close tickets on the Helpdesk ticketing platform.
  Assists with the installation, configuration, and ongoing usability of desktop computers, peripheral equipment and software within established standards and guidelines.
  On-boarding /Off-boarding: Setup/remove hardware/software and mobile devices upon arrival and departure. For onboarding – assist with first login: set printers and e-signature; change login password; setup mobile device and telephone.
  Assist with ensuring the security of all systems and equipment including reporting and remediating phishing and malware attacks.
  Printer support and maintenance such as clearing print queues.
 PHYSICAL DEMANDS
 Intermittent physical activity including reaching, prolonged periods of sitting, bending, or lifting (up to 50lbs)
  Good organizational skills
 QUALIFICATIONS: 
 No experience necessary we will train
  Basic understanding of Microsoft Office suite, Microsoft Windows 10 operating system, Windows 11.
  Experience with Apple iOS a plus. Excellent client service skills, with a strong emphasis on “user” satisfaction
 We offer a positive and friendly atmosphere with opportunities for advancement and personal growth. Salary is commensurate with experience.
 We offer medical, dental, life and vision insurance, STD and LTD insurance. We also offer a flexible benefits account, an optional wellness program and a matching 401(k) plan.
 Please submit your resume accompanied by a cover letter clearly referencing the job title of IT Junior Helpdesk Support.

As a network of Tech Support Experts, we’re defining a new way to deliver Tech Help over the phone to customers facing Tech issues. Providing our users with a delightful experience is critical to our success, so we're looking for a Tech Support Expert to take charge of customer happiness.
 The right person will be comfortable providing help to customers with a variety of online services and tech products, as our customers have basic technology questions. And right now we're especially interested in someone who can help on the weekends!
 If you love solving customer problems, then this is the place for you.
 And most importantly... this position is entirely flexible and fully remote! Hours are up to you, as we have no set schedule for our Tech Support Experts.
 Responsibilities
 On any given day, you’ll be doing one or all of these things:
 Troubleshoot and find simple solutions to customer issues. Don't be afraid to be creative!
  Absolute passion in being the voice of 6YA to our customers
  Delivering a delightful experience over the phone and showing your passion for helping customers struggling with technology
  And also... have fun! Customers love it when our Tech Support Experts show that they enjoy helping others.
 Must Haves
 Technical Aptitude - must have skills working with popular online services like Facebook, Uber, etc.
  2+ years experience in a previous Tech or Customer Support role, or an equivalent role requiring customer related communication
  A good listener, empathetic, and patient. We want to make sure that our customer's know that we are there for them
  Strong relationship building skills and a clear communicator
  Effective problem-solving skills
  Ability to manage multiple priorities and tasks simultaneously
  Analytical and Creative
  Fully Remote
 If this sounds like a good fit, please apply through our Website by clicking "Apply on Company Website" above. We hire Experts of all kinds, but right now our top priority is Tech Friendly "Tech Support Experts" who are happy to help our customers!
 So if you're interested, take a couple minutes to fill out our application and we'll be sure to get back to you quickly!

Get to know us
Meet Retarus, a global technology firm specializing in enterprise-level communications. We help optimize business processes for many of our loyal clients in the Fortune 500 sector. Visit our Company website to see some of the largest institutions that trust us!
Are you looking for job security but crave the dynamic feel of entrepreneurship? You’ve come to the right place, Retarus has stability since 1992 yet the energy of a startup. We are growing our International presence in the USA - to continue that growth, we are looking for an energetic and determined individual to join the team!
The Support Specialist
The position is remote but the ideal candidate will be located in the NJ/NYC area and possess the desire to handle responsibility. The Support Specialist will be providing customer support related but not limited to fax and SMS over SMTP, Web Service, API, FTP protocols. The Support Specialist will report directly to the Head of IT for Retarus USA. If you're excited to be part of a winning team, Retarus is a great place to grow your career.
Our Investment in youA competitive base salary!
Benefits such as Medical, Dental & Vision coverage, 401K plan
Discount programs, child care programs
International Rotation Program
Fun, modern, and diverse office that is dog friendly!
Free fresh fruits, snacks and drinks
Work life balance with competitive PTO, paid sick leave and hybrid work schedule
Flat hierarchies and a company culture that promotes growth

What You'll NeedStrong passion for IT, innovation and business processes
Strong customer facing skills, the ability to interact in confidence with clients
Preferred experience in Technical Support
Knowledge of web services and API’s
Understanding the basic HTTP requests and different methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
Practical knowledge of the SMTP protocol
Understanding of TCP/IP stack and OSI Model
Ability to provide step by step technical help, both written and verbal
Must have excellent customer relations skills with ability to communicate effectively with all levels of client organization
Unix/Python Shell Scripting skills is a plus
CompTIA A+, network + or Linux + certification is a plus

What You'll Do
Support specialists are the first point of contact for Retarus customers for fax and SMS related issues
Maintain high level of customer service to all support requests and adhere to standard policies and procedures.
Record and track support problems in help desk software while keeping end user informed of problem status and estimated resolution times; escalate issues as necessary
Manage multiple tasks and prioritize work load
Provide various service reports to customers
Demonstrate communication skills and the ability to interface directly with customers and senior leadership
Work closely with Global Headquarters Support

Retarus is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Remote Account Helpdesk Freelance Agent

Do you want a home-based role with flexibility that works around you? Make it yours!

We are looking for self-motivated and customer-focused professionals to join our Global Account Helpdesk team and support our millions of customers around the world on a freelance basis with flexible hours and based from home.

This is an opportunity to work with a market-leading International company on a self-employed freelance basis, in a way that fits around you and your life. You will work from home so if you want to earn a good income, but your personal circumstances or lifestyle prevent you from committing to a 9 to 5, this may be the opportunity you have been looking for.

Role purpose

 We are committed to providing a first-class service to our millions of customers who use our flexible workspace services. You will help to resolve customer queries, delivering exceptional service, every time.

The specific responsibilities are:
Handling customer service queries via telephone and
Resolve account, billing and payment
Update Customers on the progress of their query when first-contact resolution is not
Liaise with other departments, where needed, to provide a speedy and quality resolution to our
Manage Customer complaints and queries in our
Ensure we meet our agreed customer service

About IWG

IWG operates a portfolio of companies such as Regus, Spaces, No18, Open office, Signature and Basepoint. We help millions of people have a Great Day at Work across 3,400 locations in over 115 countries. We create personal, financial, and strategic value for businesses of every size. From some of the most exciting companies and well-known organisations on the planet, to individuals and the next generation of industry leaders

The opportunity

We operate teams of Freelance International Account Helpdesk Agents from a number of service centres around the world to provide support services to our customers. As a self-employed Freelance Agent you will help the Global Account Helpdesk team to deliver great service to our customers.

In order to qualify for this opportunity, you are required to confirm the following:
You can operate on a freelance basis (you will be self-employed, not an employee of IWG)
You can work from home in a dedicated area – any hours day or night, but you must be committed to resolving a minimum of 100 queries per month with a goal of 200+
You own a laptop/PC with Windows 10, as a minimum
Your home internet speed is 10MBPS or above
You are paid for every customer query you resolve on a monthly basis – the more you do, the more you will earn.
You can speak and write fluently in English

Overview: 
   SMBC is in process of leading a Digital Transformation across our Americas Division as we continue to modernize our technology, focus on our data driven approach, grow and plan for the future.
  
   As a result of these efforts SMBC is seeking a Desktop Support Associate who will be primarily responsible for providing technical on-site and remote support for all users. The ideal candidate is driven by technology evolution, a self-starter with exceptional people and problem-solving skills, deliver exceptional customer service, and the ability to resolve complex problems and identify solutions with little or no guidance.
  
   In this position you will provide desktop/mobile, application and general IT support for all users in the organization. This person will be part of the Level 2 support team which work closely with the HelpDesk to provide superior support to the Business. Responsibilities: 
  Promptly respond to technology support issues on a 24x7x365 on-call rotation.
    Working closely with the IT HelpDesk to provide second line technical support for user issues, ensuring assigned calls are responded to, diagnosed and resolved swiftly and effectively. Ensure outstanding calls are regularly updated to reflect the current status.
    To maintain an up-to-date level of knowledge with regards to technology, in particular security policies and company standards.
    Document actions, alterations and procedures to ensure an accurate and accessible record of the current state of the system.
    Assist other members of the Desktop Support team when appropriate to complete tasks in the necessary timescale.
    Keep abreast of trends in technology and its application to understand current best practice, possible alternative solutions and to support problem solving.
    Manage own time to fulfill tasks efficiently, in the correct priority and to the required level of quality, within the context of the objectives supplied by manager.
    Communicate the progress of investigations and planned solutions to customers, managing their level of expectation and increasing their understanding of company desktop technology.
    Liaise with colleagues, utilizing their expertise to solve more complex problems or pass on responsibility to the appropriate IT Architecture team. 
   Continuously look for improvement within Support.
    The support of mobile devices including iPhone, iPad, iPod, Android, and Windows & Apple laptops and desktops.
    Audio visual system setup and support in residential and business environments.
    Maintain asset management of Owners’ end-user devices (mobile, desktops and laptops).
    People or Process Management Responsibility: Works on assignments that require judgment and interaction with all areas of the Business.
    Participate in Moves, Adds and Changes for individuals and as part of a larger project
   Qualifications: 
  3 - 5 years experience in IT Support
    College degree is preferred but not required
    Desirable to hold Apple, Microsoft Certified Professional, Microsoft Technology Specialist or equivalent technical certification.
    Remote Support Experience
    Experience with end point management tools, such as SCCM, Microsoft Endpoint Manager
    Experience with Service Now is a plus

Expertise on Win 7 & Win10 OS troubleshooting

  L1 troubleshooting skills and support for enterprise grade printers such as Lexmark, HP, Canon, Xerox etc
  Level 2 troubleshooting mainly related to desktop/OS, Custom and COTS applications, Exchange related, End devices, VPN, VOIP and share point as per guidelines in the knowledgebase

Do you love solving tech challenges? Do you like working directly with clients and making their lives easier? 
 We are building a team of IT problem solvers who thrive on delighting customers. We do very important work that keeps our clients productive and secure, so when IT issues arise, members of our team love to work quickly to devise and implement the fix. We pride ourselves on owning the client’s problem and delivering empathetic, high-touch, white-glove service all the way to the solution.
 The Position
 You'll be responsible for managing our ticket queue and providing day-to-day IT support to our clients by phone, email, videoconference, and in-person. You’ll need to be proficient with Macs and PCs, Google Apps, and Office365. Since you’ll be talking to people every day (using that ancient technology called “the phone"), you also need to be an empathetic listener who quickly establishes trust with our clients.
 Our team is cross-trained on all the systems we support, and our work varies from one day to the next. Your background will include time working for a managed IT service provider or a small organization (10-20 staff) where you had to wear multiple IT hats and deal with all the systems a business would use.
 Company Culture and Benefits
 We care about your health and wellbeing: We believe work-life balance is important, which is why the founder has built a company that works mostly during daytime hours. We ask that our employees are 100% dedicated to the company from 9:00 am – 6:00 pm US Pacific Time Monday - Friday (that means 12p-9p Eastern, 11a-8p Central, 10a-7p Mountain), leaving most evenings and weekends for personal hobbies, commitments, and overall well-being.
 Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our culture: We set aside 10% of your weekly hours towards this objective, and our founder will personally meet with you each week to help develop your training plan and track your progress towards it.
 Members of our team enjoy a comprehensive pay package that includes salary, vacation, comprehensive medical benefits, and an annual performance bonus.

 Pay: $60,000.00 - $72,000.00 per year

Technical Account Manager (TAM) - equivalent to Level II IT specialist
 Secured Managed Services and Cybersecurity
 Cerberus Sentinel – Pennington NJ.
 Full-Time
 Cerberus Sentinel has an excellent opportunity for a Technical Account Manager in our Secured Managed Services (SMS) practice. As a member of the Managed IT Services team, the candidate will be responsible for providing support to our business customers on all technical aspects of desktop computers, laptops, servers, printers, network infrastructure, mobile devices, and various wireless equipment on Microsoft, Apple, and Android platforms. Our support requests come in via online ticket system and incoming phone calls. Candidate will be required to perform both remote and onsite support for our customers located in central NJ.
 JOB RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES
 · Document all incoming helpdesk tickets and attempt to resolve or escalate
 · Assist with deployment of new equipment
 · End user support for all desktops, laptops, and mobile devices.
 · Microsoft Windows Server infrastructures support for basic roles. (AD, DHCP, DNS, File, Print)
 · Malware removal and protection with various small business and Enterprise level products.
 · Hardware failure diagnosis on desktops, laptops, and servers.
 · Network hardware support; routers, switches, wireless technology.
 · Office 365 / Azure Administration
 SKILLSET
 · Good presentation skills
 · Strong customer service and interpersonal skills
 · Strong analytical skills with the ability to quickly learn new technologies and environments
 · Attention to detail
 · Excellent verbal/written communication
 · Excellent organizational skills and the ability to be self-sufficient
 REQUIREMENTS
 · Minimum 2 years working experience supporting technologies listed above.
 · Experience troubleshooting desktops, laptops, and mobile devices.
 · Experience with basic windows server roles.
 · Understanding of basic networking technologies
 · Relevant education and certifications preferred
 SCHEDULE: 
 · Applicant will be required to work out of our customers facility
 · General working hours are 9am to 5pm, Monday – Friday
 · Additional work may be required outside of standard hours
 COMPENSATION: 
 · $55-75k Base salary depending on experience
 Why Work Here?
 We focus on acquiring world-class talent who specialize in succeeding over big challenges. Take your career to the next level!
 Cerberus Sentinel is a publicly traded company listed with ticker CISO. We are a nationwide provider of cybersecurity consulting and managed services, with offices and resources across the US. We specialize in building a security-centric culture for our clients using an education-based approach.
 We are passionate about helping businesses deliver operational excellence within Information Technology, Security and Compliance disciplines … become more secure and go beyond “checking a box” – we provide relationship-based services, not transactional ones. Our clients love that we truly make a difference and give them peace of mind. We like simplifying an unnecessarily overly complicated industry, protecting people from having their medical devices hacked, and securing businesses and families from disaster.

Job Description
The helpdesk resource will provide technical support, and resolve all incoming calls/issues from clients.
Provides remote technical support for a functional help desk.
This resource will also work with vendors and other SMEs to identify and resolve complex client issues.
Provides dedicated tier 2 technical support for a business unit as an extension of the help desk.
Responsible for resolving incoming calls from direct contact, delivered to the helpdesk and managing escalated cases.
Responds to a variety of technical issues from incoming calls or cases escalated by other help desk staff.
Provides technical guidance and consults with vendors and other systems support units to identify and resolve complex client problems.
Alerts clients and team members when a major problem is suspected. Performs recovery testing to confirm availability of systems where outages have occurred.
Documents and tracks status of client inquiries, coordinates appropriate response and follows up to ensure client satisfaction.
Participates in the analysis of client identified issues or problems which may require changes to department procedures, standards or systems.
Evaluates effectiveness of new utilities and tools.
Performs related duties as assigned or requested.Qualifications:
Strong customer service skills

Crypto holders can earn yield on the digital assets in their account with Celsius, and can borrow fiat or stablecoins against their crypto collateral at the lowest interest rates in the space.

     Company Profile
     Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.
    
   
    Department Profile
     Operations is one of the largest divisions in the firm and has diverse responsibilities, including correctly settling and recording millions of transactions per day, identifying and mitigating all operational risks, developing strong client relationships and partnering with technology to realize the full potential of IT and e-solutions. Throughout, the Operations department continually seeks ways to improve while actively supporting the development of new businesses, structures and markets.
    
   
    E*TRADE, a member of the Morgan Stanley family of companies offers a full spectrum of benefits, including Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental, Vision, Flexible Spending Account or Health Savings Account, Life Insurance, Disability and other Insurance Plans, Paid Time Off (including Sick Leave, Parental Leave and Vacation), Holidays, 401(k) and financial wellness plans in addition to other special perks reserved for our employees. The role will be a hands-on partner with E*TRADE Corporate Services and will be focused on Cash movement, Trade Settlement, Share Deliveries and Tax/Cost Basis reporting for ETRADE Corporate Services (ETCS) Stock Plan transactions.

DriveWealth, the pioneer of fractional equities trading and embedded investing, is a visionary technology company that empowers more than 100 partners around the world to engage their customers by placing the markets in the palm of their hand. We believe the future is fractional, transactional and mobile. Every mobile device should be a gateway to accessing investing and savings products, services, advice, and assistance for global citizens of all ages, wealth stages, and levels of financial expertise. DriveWealth's unparalleled consultative support and cloud-based, industrial strength technology platform allow partners to seamlessly offer branded investing experiences to drive customer acquisition, loyalty, retention, and revenue growth. DriveWealth's commitment to continuous evolution and innovation makes it the partner of choice for powering the future of investing.

Recently completing a Series D raise, DriveWealth's mission is to democratize investing globally by working with partners to invent new ways to use its API-based technology to provide emerging investors with cutting-edge embedded experiences, offer first-time access to U.S. markets, and the ability to begin investing with as little as $1. DriveWealth is committed to empowering consumers around the world to become owners by delivering the most modern brokerage infrastructure, unparalleled industry expertise, and a culture of continued evolution.
About the Role

DriveWealth is looking for a candidate to help ease the manual processes of the Operations teams across the Margin, Treasury, Corporate Actions, Settlements Ops Control, Self Clearing, and other departments. We are looking for a candidate that can build a fast & dynamic automation solution.

The ideal candidate is someone who can work well in a team environment and can communicate effectively between technical experts and with team members with no technical background. This is an innovative role with high autonomy to develop ad hoc reports quickly, accurately and dynamically. At times, the automations created are short-term solutions until a long-term API solution is implemented internally.

What You'll Do
Create automation scripts as needed
Participate in the retesting process once bugs and issues have been resolved
Assist the team in troubleshooting issues that may arise during the testing phase, offering appropriate technical recommendations
Proactively improve our existing tasks, helping to build out the environment we want for ourselves as we grow and grow our business
Communicate effectively across multiple teams is crucial
What You'll Need
1-2 years experience preferred
Intermediate-level Python/SQL skills is a must
Must be able to write syntax that implements SQL queries of several relational /foreign databases, repositories, and API calls
Must be able to write definitions which will be implemented dynamically (daily, monthly, on trigger) as tasks and jobs
Experience in RDMS or some form of database management/engineering is a plus
Critical analytical & short-term problem-solving skills is a must
Self-starter who can get the job done despite obstacles
Willingness to innovate and improvise
Ability to work well in a team environment that includes both types of coworkers (technical experts and non-technical experts)
Ability to handle multiple tasks at once while maintaining implemented processes (that were previously finished projects)
Enthusiastic about working in a fast-changing environment
Undergraduate major in computer science or data science or experience equivalent

Trading Strategy & Operations Analyst
Jersey City, New Jersey
About Us
We are BetMGM. We are revolutionizing sports betting and online gaming in the United States. We are a partnership between two powerhouse organizations—MGM Resorts International and Entain Group. You know our name through our exciting portfolio of brands including BetMGM Sportsbook, Borgata online, Party Casino and Party Poker. We aim to bring our ideas into action and find ways to deliver the best quality in gaming platforms.
We understand that each card in the deck plays a unique role in any given hand, just as our employees each play a unique role in accomplishing our goals as a company. We strive to create a culture of empathy where our employees feel valued, heard, and comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work. We want to build a product and a workplace that reflect the communities we serve so we approach our work fearlessly, take responsibility when we get it wrong, and ante-up again. We play to win, and we are all-in together.
We were recognized as one of Glassdoor’s “Best Places to Work”.
About the Role
The Trading Strategy & Operations Analyst will support the Director of Trading and the Trading Process & Performance Manager on strategic initiatives within BetMGM’s Retail and Digital Sports Trading divisions. The individual will be responsible for enhancing documentation and management of Trading processes and tracking performance metrics.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with manager to identify and put in place metrics to track success against established KPIs
Enhance and manage documentation around Trading processes, policies and procedures in both BetMGM Digital platform and Retail trading systems
Identify ways to improve efficiency and effectiveness of processes and procedures
Leverage data analytic tools to produce specific insights around Trader performance
Support integrity monitoring capabilities including compiling integrity reports
Maintain Trading Internal Controls, implementing changes as required by new legislation or regulations in coordination with Compliance
Education
Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent practical experience)
Qualifications
Data-driven strategic thinker with exceptional problem-solving skills
Proficiency in data analytics tools (Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Advanced Excel preferred)
Strong organizational & project management skills, with the ability to juggle multiple projects at once
Knowledge of sports betting market fundamentals and understanding of different sports
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Familiarity with data visualization tools and experience using visualizations to convey business impact
Experience at a sports, media or tech company preferred
About Our Culture
Building BetMGM from the ground up takes effort, energy, and teamwork, but that’s what will make leading this industry all the more satisfying. We stay focused on our main goal with the help of these four company pillars:
Believe in Your Game – Take your shot! There’s a freedom to explore ideas usually only start-ups are lucky enough to experience.
Backed by the Best - With our expertise—merged with that of our world-class investors—we have the opportunity to take this business, and ourselves, farther than anyone has ever imagined.
Do What’s Right - We operate with clarity and simplicity, always doing the right thing by our customers and each other, standing shoulder to shoulder every day.
Hustle Hard - Our combined commitment and ambition is what drives us to create some of the most innovative products in the industry.
What We Offer
As a valued employee, we’re committed to giving you the resources and support you need. We offer Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Paid Time Off, Holidays, Employee Resource Groups and more!
Gaming Compliance
Candidate must comply with and support the company’s responsible gambling policies, procedures and initiatives.

BlueVine is on a mission to empower small businesses with innovative banking designed for them. Small businesses deserve accessible and modern financial services, and traditional banks have underserved them for too long.

By combining industry-leading technology and security with our team's expertise and care, we help small businesses spend their time on what matters most—the next chapter of their business.

Since 2013, we've provided small and medium-sized businesses with access to more than $5.4 billion in financing. As a top small business banking provider trusted by thousands of small business owners, we're proud to offer a full suite of tailored banking services, including a business checking account, line of credit, and invoice factoring.

Headquartered in Redwood City, CA, and with offices in Salt Lake City, Jersey City, Tel Aviv, and Karmiel, we're hiring problem solvers and collaborators to help build a better financial future for small business owners.

ABOUT THE ROLE

As Business Operations Senior Analyst at BlueVine, you will use analytical rigor to uncover new opportunities to drive operational excellence, positioning BlueVine as a best-in-class financial services platform for small businesses. Taking a whole-company lens to your problem-solving, you will deliver highly visible work with large impact across our lines of business.

This is not a fully remote role. At BlueVine, we pride ourselves on our collaborative culture, which we believe is best maintained through in-person interactions and a vibrant office environment. All of our offices will reopen in accordance with local guidelines, and will follow a hybrid model.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Generate and communicate high-impact business insights by designing and executing analyses
Design and partner to execute experiments touching client acquisition, the product experience, and operations; analyze results and refine the experimental agenda on an ongoing basis
Building on your analyses and experimental results, make recommendations targeting increased customer lifetime value, improved acquisition efficiency, reduced operational inefficiency, and reduced risk
Own and refine standard performance reporting for our lines of business
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand value drivers, client needs, and opportunities for operational improvement
Once new processes are implemented, work with teams to analyze results, scale best practices, and iterate when needed
WHAT WE LOOK FOR
Bachelor's degree from a top university
1.5+ years of experience at a top management consulting firm, investment bank, or similar experience
Comfort designing and executing analysis of large data sets; SQL proficiency and Tableau experience preferred but not required
Excellent problem-solving skills and an ability to gather information, solve conceptual problems, and drive cross-functional execution
Strong verbal and written communication skills across formats (email, slides, dashboards)
A bias toward action paired with strong organizational and documentation skills
Comfort working on multiple high-priority projects concurrently, including with limited time and data
Passion for working in a fast-paced, dynamic, global environment
Benefits & Perks:
Over $1,000 annually for a wellness benefit of your choice
Monthly WFH stipend
PTO, Company Holiday, and Flexible Holidays
Excellent health coverage and life insurance benefits
Generous, paid parental leave covering up to 16 weeks
401K with an immediate 3% company match
Access to financial coaches and education sessions
Company-sponsored Mental Health Benefits, including 1:1 therapy
Community-based volunteering opportunities
Free commuter benefits - Caltrain passes for San Francisco employees and a monthly parking allowance
Weekly catered lunches and fully stocked kitchen pantries
Quarterly DoorDash credit
Dog-friendly HQ

  Kelly Services is currently seeking a Senior Data Operations Analyst one of our top clients this is located onsite in New Brunswick, NJ.

  This position will execute day-to-day operations to support the strategy of the function across franchises/business units. Will develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate scope and complexity, referring to established policies and procedures.
   
  The Data Operations team delivers trusted data to enable the launch & supply of products to our customers. Our key accountabilities include governance and maintenance of the Data Operations Framework; delivering a regulated and compliant data environment; using intelligent automation, workflow, process improvements, cross-segment expertise, and third-party suppliers to improve quality, timeliness, cost, and effort across Supply Chain; applying deep end-to-end knowledge and subject matter expertise to define, shape and implement supply chain strategies; and cultivating talent as a distinctive capability.

  Monitor and execute the data operations and data quality process. May include coordination of testing, error handling, data conversion and/or validation, and audit/compliance actions (Non-Conformance (NC) and/or Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)). Provide tactical direction to third party team(s) and function as first level escalation.

May include completion of complex change assessments and/or project scoping requirements, point of escalation for both internal and external team members, single point of contact for strategic launches and audit/compliance activities, participate in and sometimes lead operational meetings with data owners. 
   Day-to-day responsibilities for working with various stakeholders and SMEs to not only determine strategies to either solve data related issues that occur, determine opportunities to improve current state processes, and determine new future state processes. 
   Quickly gain knowledge to learn the current processes related to the department and the end-to-end information needed to understand and assess the impact of data to the business and systems upstream and downstream of where the department is engaged and key to these processes. 
   Understanding of processes to review and update work instructions and process flows (as required) 
   Execute required responsibilities to comply with SOX protocols utilizing customer maintenance updates within respective systems. 
   Prepare metrics, dashboards, and tracking to facilitate the efficient operations of the Data Operations department. May execute budget and/or value capture protocol within established framework Participate in, and sometimes lead, operational and governance meetings which may include end-to-end, value capture, and third-party reviews. 
   Contribute to the creation and maintenance of documentation for area of responsibility. May include Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, and other policy and procedure documents. Develop and deliver training to educate stakeholders on documented procedures, data flows, etc.
   
  Requirements/Qualifications
   
  Supply chain experience, preferably in master data, operations, or multi-functional business environment. 
   Basic business and/or technical knowledge and understanding of Supply Chain data elements, process, and organizational support models. 
   MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word) 
   Strong written, oral, and presentation skills 
   Strong organizational and prioritization skills. 
   Ability to build strong collaborative relationships, influence multiple partners, and establish common goals and objectives without sacrificing outcomes. 
   Ability to contribute on a diverse, multicultural, and partially remote team. 
   Ability to prioritize multiple initiatives within timelines, in a matrix environment where priorities change rapidly.

About Pinterest:
Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It's where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you'll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You'll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.

Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that's uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our PinFlex landing page to learn more.
With +400 million Pinners and tens of billions of Pins, there's a massive supply of data on Pinterest—one of the most interesting data sets in the world. As an Analyst on the Global Insights Strategy team, you will perform analyses and build team efficiencies to help sell the unique value of Pinterest to our advertisers.These projects will teach advertisers about their customers and categories on Pinterest and give recommendations for ad targeting, keywords, and creative. You will also support Researchers in developing and executing 1st party Pinterest insights to go alongside larger-scope research studies. You will build efficiencies to scale projects, and help strengthen engagement with key stakeholders.
What you'll do:
Drive the mechanics, production & communication of Pinterest's internal insights database
Support the mid-market and small business sectors by developing insights from 1P analysis of Pinterest data set
Repurpose insights via unique storytelling for mid-market/small-business unique needs
Manage Insights team financial budget navigating procurement and contract process
Find and build efficiencies to scale insights work product globally
Collaborate effectively with teams -analysts, researchers, team leads - to support their operational needs
What we're looking for:
Demonstrated experience in scaling processes using technology and/or tools
Outstanding project management skills; verbal and written communication skills
Innovative and analytical thinker with a disciplined and organized approach
High attention to detail, flexible, and collaborative; comfortable with ambiguity
Self-motivated, enthusiastic and driven to grow
You approach your work, your colleagues, and life in general with curiosity, humility, and an openness to learning new things
Passion for Pinterest's mission, supporting businesses and improving the product experience

Job summary
The Organization

Do you want to directly influence the future of some of the most successful products in cloud computing? Come join Amazon Web Services Finance! Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of enterprise, government, and start-up businesses and organizations in over 190 countries around the world.

The AWS Finance team provides end-to-end financial support for this multi-billion dollar business, driving AWS to be the leader in customer experience while delivering best cost. On the AWS Finance team, you will be surrounded by people that are exceptionally talented, bright, and driven, and believe that world class support is critical to customer success. You should be passionate about producing financial analysis enabling management to make breakthrough decisions, drive cash flow, and ultimately delight our customers.

The Position

You will join the Global Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) team within AWS Data Center Infrastructure Operations Finance. The position will contribute to driving standardization and team efficiency worldwide. You will be responsible for coordinating and liaison with the central FP&A on behalf of the regional finance teams. Over time you will get exposure to how the organization plans and forecasts annual Opex and capex budgets on a global basis. You will be the finance expert responsible for budgeting, variance analysis, and driving key financial metrics. You will partner across finance and non-finance teams to drive forecasting, financial analysis, reporting, and key financial decisions. You will also define and maintain internal finance controls for transactions and processes. This role will also support ad-hoc analysis and reporting related to data center operations. This is a highly visible role as your outputs are included in month end packages that go to senior leadership and decision makers.

The FP&A team is responsible for managing the financial rhythms of the business, including the annual operating plan, long range plan, regular forecast process, and for providing analytical support to senior management. You will help establish the pace of the finance team to ensure it delivers actionable insights in a timely manner.
Key job responsibilities
The Responsibilities
Partner with Data Center regional finance teams to meet finance objectives.
Drive month end reporting and variance analysis of actual spend versus projection.
Lead ad hoc analysis and month end financial commentary working cross functionally with regional finance, central finance, and financial systems (TM1) and accounting teams.
Ensure compliance with finance and accounting controls and systems.
Monitor and enhance existing processes and controls.
Preferred Qualifications - MBA degree.
Ability to work with remote finance and business groups.
Ability to work independently, partner cross-functionally, and be self-motivated.
Ability to influence partners across the organization
Highly organized with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Experience optimizing finance processes for speed, agility, and insight.
Ability to dissent, while building trust with business partners.
Experience with SQL or business intelligence.
Experience in financial modeling and reporting using Excel.
Experience with financial software including Oracle, Essbase, TM1, or similar tools.

 JOB DESCRIPTION 
 Whether the day’s work entails conducting surveillance, identifying leads, interviewing suspects or advising on national security, our work is far more than a typical 9 to 5. Because our Special Agents bring varied backgrounds and knowledge to their role — from educators, athletes and IT specialists to lawyers, linguists and counselors — collectively, they bring their skill sets and unique talents to focus on cybercrime, counterintelligence, counterterrorism and beyond.
 You can expect continued specialized training once onboard and opportunities to work on some of the Bureau's most complex cases. The scope and scale of our investigations provide unique challenges unlike anything you could work on in the private sector. Your ultimate mission: to protect the American people and uphold the Constitution of the United States.
 SALARY LEVEL
 $66,991.25 – $86,442.50
 Salary is commensurate to experience and location.
 DUTIES 
 Candidates must:
 Adhere to strict standards of conduct.
  Undergo a rigorous background investigation, credit checks and a polygraph in order to obtain a Top Secret Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) Clearance.
  Pass a Physical Fitness Test (PFT); must be physically fit to complete training at the FBI Academy at Quantico, VA, and maintain a high level of fitness throughout your career.
  Pass a medical exam, which includes, but is not limited to, meeting visual and hearing standards.
  Successfully complete approximately 19 weeks of employment as a Special Agent trainee, while housed at the FBI Academy at Quantico.
  Upon graduation from the FBI Academy, be available to transfer to one of the FBI's 56 Field Offices, including San Juan, Puerto Rico or remote resident agencies (satellite offices) to meet the needs of the FBI. Special Agents rarely return to their processing office. Applicants should ensure that their families are prepared for and support this move.
  Throughout your career, be available for temporary duty assignments anywhere in the world, on either a temporary or a long-term basis.
  Work a minimum of a 50-hour workweek, which may include irregular hours, and be on-call 24/7, including holidays and weekends.
  Be willing and able to participate in arrests, execute search warrants, raids and similar assignments.
 In addition, All Special Agent candidates must successfully complete the Special Agent Selection System (SASS), a mentally and physically challenging process designed to find only the most capable applicants. The selection process typically takes one year or more to complete.
 KEY REQUIREMENTS
 You must:
 Be a U.S. citizen.
  Be at least 23 years old and not have reached your 37th birthday on appointment.
  Be able to obtain a Top Secret SCI Clearance.
  Have two years of full-time professional work experience (see work experience waiver for exceptions).
  Meet the FBI’s Employment Eligibility requirements.
  Possess a valid driver’s license with at least six months driving experience.
 EDUCATION 
 Candidates must have a bachelor’s degree or higher from a U.S.-accredited college or university.
 All degrees must be from an accredited college or university and must be verified by submitting college transcripts.

 No

We are looking for an experienced high-energy payment specialist to support our payment operations department. The right candidate for this position will support initiatives related to payment processing and biller management. This candidate will also be detailed oriented, hands-on, and comfortable interacting with clients and is committed to delivering a superior client experience.
 The job of the Payment Support Specialist is to perform a variety of duties to support the Payment Operations Department. Primary functions will be to respond to the client’s needs regarding the processing of payments and system functionality. The person in this role is a subject matter expert, responsible for understanding best practices, driving client satisfaction, and implementing change to optimize payment research resolution time.
 The individual will have the opportunity to:
 Proactively leverage the Payrailz platform to enhance the end-user bill payment experience.
  Contribute in a “hands-on” manner to achieve operational excellence and exceed customer expectations.
  Make recommendations for systemic workflow improvements based on real-world situations requiring manual actions.
  Interact with billers and partners in support of payment operations.
  Work with a team of talented and committed professionals.
  Be a key team member and add direct value to our growing organization.
  Advance financially and professionally as results are delivered.
 This position reports directly to the VP of Payment Operations
 A DAY IN THE LIFE:
 This person’s daily life would include all the following responsibilities and activities:
 Contact billers via phone and email to resolve payment issues on behalf of end-users.
  Resolve PRRs (Payment research requests) in the queue.
  Manage and resolve issues with biller account numbers and biller payment posting issues.
  Monitor and process check returns
  Manages the 3rd party loan / credit cards payment system used for on-boarding of financial institutions. (i.e., Credit Pay Pro)
  Become the subject matter expert on the 3rd party payment processing system used for address verification, account authorization, eBills (i.e. Smarty, Plaid, Finovera)
  Provide payments support to client financial institution CSRs.
  Support payee and payment management for large client conversions.
  Resolve payee and payment issues for biller consolidations
  Deal with all payment exceptions.
  Provide on-demand Proof of Payment
 IDEAL CANDIDATE CHARACTERISTICS:
 We believe the person who will be successful in this important role will have the following attributes:
 Thrives in a start-up company culture.
  Has a strong work ethic and successful experience working with remote staff.
  Has a sense of intellectual curiosity and an addiction to learning.
  Is self-driven, actively looks for ways to contribute, and knows how to get things done.
  Understands and models customer-focus.
  Values data and truth over ego.
  Has good communication and reasoning skills, including the ability to gain consensus across functional areas and stakeholders.
  Respects and values others’ opinions even when they differ from their own.
  AND has a great sense of humor. We like to see people enjoying what they do!
 EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION:
 Minimum 5+ years of experience in Banking Operations, Payment Operations, and/or ACH
  ACH, Check, and Card processing
  Vendor relationship management (MC/RPPS)
  Operational compliance
  Fraud management
  Customer support and relations
  Possess strong data analytic and reporting skills with excellent critical thinking, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
  Experience with the following: Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, & PowerPoint), Atlassian Suite (Jira, Confluence, Stride), Smarty (SmartSheet), video conferencing tools, and chat technologies.
 Ideally, the candidate should have a bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university, or equivalent experience representing 5+ years of payment operations in the financial technology industry.
 PAYRAILZ OVERVIEW:
 Payrailz is an innovative company with great people and a reputation for being genuine. Built around three core values of respect, integrity, and transparency we provide a rewarding working environment where our people feel valued, respected, and part of something big. For thought-leading Financial Institutions looking to stand out from the competition, Payrailz provides the most innovative, engaging, and feature-rich digital payment experiences in the marketplace today.
 Backed by superior service and based on a clear understanding of the business of banking and payments, Payrailz empowers FI’s to truly compete and provide end-users with a secure payment experience they will rely on and use over other competitor offerings.
 Through innovation, agility, and a willingness to approach the business of payments with new thinking, we provide the ability to deliver a full range of “smart” payment solutions that improve the overall end-user payments experience while fully taking advantage of modern technologies (such as the cloud, AI, API, Open data exchange and workflow management) to delight both consumers and businesses.
 Built for the cloud, Payrailz enables financial institutions to engage loyal customers as well as attract the next generation with simplified and smarter payment capabilities that improve operations and enhance the overall customer experience. By working with Payrailz, Banks and Credit Unions can exceed ever-changing demands with the confidence to succeed today and tomorrow.
 Payrailz’ atmosphere of innovative thinking, superior technology, and dedication to its employees make Payrailz an ideal organization for a person looking to make a difference.

This position is a work from home role. Preference is for this position to be domiciled in the North East as overnight travel is required within this geographical area.
 Hiring for multiple position levels:  Environmental Compliance Specialist I, II, Sr.
 Job Summary 
 Oversees and supports legal and regulatory environmental compliance by administering related programs, projects and functions, as well as by providing technical and training support to field operations. Serves as a knowledge resource to other environmental compliance specialists and field operations personnel. Coordinates and provides oversight to contracted environmental consultants and vendors.
 Essential Functions
 Implements and monitors environmental compliance programs for an established territory working closely with other compliance specialists to support regional compliance programs. Programs may include, but are not limited to, stormwater, wastewater, hazardous materials, hazardous waste, air quality, above and/or below ground storage tanks, environmental due diligence, and other associated programs. Travels routinely to conduct station audits within an established territory and works with station management to create action plans to resolve identified issues. Travels routinely, and sometimes on short notice, to assist station management including, but not limited to, preparation for regulatory audits and inspections, regulatory violation response, spill response, training, community complaints, general compliance support, etc. Coordinates and communicates with internal and external customers, vendors, and local, state, and federal agencies. Oversees the process of preparing and submitting environmental permit applications to state, local, or federal agencies. Works with vendors and consultants as needed for compliance needs. Tasks include establishing scope of work, preparing project specifications, obtaining bids, submitting for budget approvals, reviewing, awarding, administering contracts, and monitoring contract spend. Provides guidance and direction to station management with the operation and maintenance of environmental related equipment, systems and controls. Serves as a hazardous materials resource to station operations implementing internal policies and procedures. Evaluates environmental assessments of property acquisitions; reports observations, conclusions, and recommendations to all levels of company management as needed. Support station management on tasks associated with the corporate internal auditing process.
 Minimum Education
 Bachelor’s degree in an environmental science, policy, compliance, or related field required.
 Minimum Experience
 Three (3) years’ experience required in environmental compliance including direct experience with at least one of the following regulatory programs: stormwater, wastewater, hazardous materials, hazardous waste, air quality, aboveground and below ground storage tanks, environmental due diligence and/or other associated programs (e.g. RCRA, CERCLA, DOT, etc.)
 Required Skills, Abilities and / or Licensure
 Familiarity with Federal and State environmental regulations related to stormwater, wastewater, hazardous materials, hazardous waste, air quality, aboveground and below ground storage tanks, environmental due diligence and/or other associated programs (e.g. RCRA, CERCLA, DOT, etc.) Software skills, including use of Microsoft Office software and web-based applications. Verbal and written communication skills necessary to explain complex and/or confidential information. Presentation skills necessary to facilitate training and/or deliver informational sessions to groups and/or individuals. Time management and organizational skills necessary to manage multiple projects, appropriately prioritize workload, plan for resources to meet deadlines and goals, and respond to day-to-day functional needs. Ability to anticipate and identify problems and use sound judgment and fact-based analysis to develop effective and efficient solutions. Ability to troubleshoot issues, manage resources, and develop solutions. Ability to mentor, coach and act as a knowledge resource to other employees. Knowledge of concepts, practices, policies and procedures used in field operations Knowledge of concepts, practices, policies, and procedures related to environmental compliance laws and regulations preferred.
 % of Travel for the Position: 25-50%

 Secaucus, NJ 07094: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Duties 
   Receives, examines, and adjudicates applications for the issuance, amendment, and replacement of passports forwarded by acceptance agents of presented by applicants of applicant representatives. 
    Examines evidence of citizenship submitted with applications to determine and judge authenticity and adequacy in relation to laws, regulation, and procedures associated with the issuance of passports. 
    Identifies gaps or inconsistencies in documentary evidence and seeks to reconcile same through judicious questioning of "walk-in" applicants, or through requests for additional documentary evidence. 
    Maintains constant ness to the possibility of fraudulent documentation or claims of identity. In cases where fraud is suspected, competes Suspected Fraudulent Application form indicating the reason for suspicion. 
    Provides advice and assistance to lower grade Specialist and participates in the on-the-job training of new examiners as assigned. 
   
   
   Requirements 
   Conditions of Employment 
   U.S. Citizenship is required. 
    Incumbent will be subject to random drug testing. 
    Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance. 
    Successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit: www.dhs.gov/E-Verify/ 
   
    Qualifications 
    
     Applicants must meet all the qualification requirements described below by the closing date of this announcement. If you are qualifying based on education OR if there are mandatory education requirements listed below, you MUST submit a copy of your college transcript with your application. 
      Applicants applying for the GS-05 must meet one of the qualification requirements listed below: 
      General Experience: 
     A. Completion of three years of general experience, one of which was equivalent to the GS-04 level, involving the analysis, explanation, application, or interpretation of laws, rules, regulations, procedures, etc. Qualifying general experience may have been gained as a law clerk, contact representative, claims examiner, voucher examiner, or similar work with a government or private employer. 
     OR 
     B. Successful completion of a full 4-year course of study in any field leading to a bachelor's degree. 
     OR 
     C. Combination of education and experience. If you do not qualify based on education or experience alone, you can combine your education and experience by converting each to a percentage and then adding the percentages. To calculate this, determine your total qualifying experience as a percentage of the experience required; then determine your education as a percentage of the education required; then add the two percentages. The total percentages must equal at least 100 percent to qualify. 
     If you are qualifying based on education, you must submit a copy of your college transcript with your application, and if selected, an official college transcript will be required to verify education prior to employment. 
      Applicants applying for the GS-07 must meet one of the qualification requirements listed below: 
      A. Completion of at least 1 full year of specialized experience (equivalent to the GS-05 level in the Federal service) that demonstrated knowledge of the immigration and/or nationality laws of the United States. Qualifying specialized experience may have been gained in work such as developing, examining, investigating, or authorizing claims arising under the immigration and/or nationality laws of the United States. 
     OR 
     B. Completion of 1 full year of graduate level education in law, or other administrative or management fields related to the position. For your information, one academic year of graduate education is considered to be the number of credit hours that your graduate school has determined to represent one academic year of full-time study. Such study may have been performed on a full-time or part-time basis. If you cannot obtain your graduate school's definition of one year of graduate study, 18 semester hours (or 27 quarter hours) should be considered as satisfying the requirement for one year of full-time graduate study. 
     OR 
     C. A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university AND you meet one of the following provisions of the superior academic achievement: 
      
      A grade-point average of "B" (3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale) for all completed undergraduate courses or those completed in the last two years of undergraduate study.
      A grade-point average of "B+" (3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale) for all courses in your major field of study, or those courses in your major completed in the last two years of your undergraduate study.
      Rank in the upper one-third of your class in the college, university, or major subdivision.
      Membership in a national honor society (other than freshman honor societies) recognized by the Association of College Honor Societies.
       
     Grade point averages should be rounded to one decimal point. For example, 2.95 is rounded to 3.0, and 2.94 is rounded to 2.9. NOTE: If more than 10 percent of your undergraduate course work (credit hours) was taken on a pass/fail or similar basis, your claim must be based on class standing or membership in an honor society. OR D. Combination of graduate level education and specialized experience. If you have some but not all of the experience or education described above, you may still qualify by combining the amount of creditable experience and education that you do have. To do so, convert each to a percentage and then add the percentages the sum of which must equal at least 100%. For example, an applicant who has 6 months of professional experience (50% of the experience requirement) and at least 9 semester hours of creditable graduate work (50% of the education required) would satisfy the qualifications requirements for the GS-07 level. 
     If you are qualifying based on education, you must submit a copy of your college transcript with your application, and if selected, an official college transcript will be required to verify education prior to employment.

   How You Will Be Evaluated 
   
    You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above. 
    
    Once the application process is complete, a review of your resume will be conducted and compared against your responses to the assessment questions to determine if you are qualified for this job. Note: Responses to questions that are not fully supported by the information in your resume may result in adjustments to your rating. 
     Applicants who meet the minimum qualification requirements, as described in the “Qualifications” section of this announcement, will be assigned to one of three quality categories: 
     
     Qualified - In addition to meeting minimum qualifications, applicants must demonstrate a basic level of the required competencies (knowledge, skills and abilities) for the position.
     Well Qualified - In addition to meeting minimum qualifications, applicants must demonstrate proficiency in some but not all of the required competencies (knowledge, skills, and abilities) for the position.
     Highly Qualified - In addition to meeting minimum qualifications, applicants must fully demonstrate proficiency in all of the required competencies (knowledge, skills and abilities) for the position.
      
    Highly Qualified applicants may be referred to the hiring manager for further consideration and possible interview. The category assignment is a measure of the degree in which your background matches the competencies (knowledge, skills, and abilities) required for this position. Your qualifications will be evaluated on the following competencies: 
    Ability to independently apply rules and regulations.
     Ability to identify inconsistencies in information/applications.
     Ability to identify problems and develop solutions.
     Ability to synthesize information to make decisions.
     Ability to work with people from different cultures/countries.

Other 10-point preference eligible and veterans with 5-point preference who meet the eligibility and qualification requirements are placed above non-preference eligible applicants within the category in which they qualify. View information on veterans' preference on OPM’s Fed Hire Vets website. 
     Agency and Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (CTAP and ICTAP) Eligibles: If you have never been a Federal employee, you are not CTAP or ICTAP eligible. View information about CTAP and ICTAP eligibility on OPM's Career Transition Resources website.  Purpose
 As a Tech Specialist your purpose is to help clients get the full and immediate benefits of implementing our recommended tech stack in their businesses. You accomplish this by doing one-to-one calls with our members and help with troubleshooting tech setup issues.
 Who You Are
 As a Tech Specialist you are a linchpin in the success of our clients. Our clients are farmers and ranchers. Many have little to no level of proficiency using online tools such as ecommerce platforms and email service providers. With your support and encouragement clients feel renewed optimism about their future. Your patient, detailed, compassionate assistance helps them take action producing results and increasing their self-confidence and belief in their ability to succeed.
  You are key to their implementation of the strategy we teach in our signature program Customers On Demand. Without you on our team to guide and support them many of our clients face a steep tech learning curve and feel frustrated, confused, and overwhelmed.
  With you on the team our clients feel supported, energized by their rapid progress and are able to get into momentum making measurable progress and producing meaningful results in their businesses.
  With you on the team our client success will skyrocket leading to greater word of mouth referrals, testimonials, and success stories which enable us to enroll and serve an ever increasing number of farming and ranching families.
 Who We Are
 We’ve been helping thousands of farmers and ranchers since 2016 market their products directly to consumers.
  Those we help learn the secrets of marketing to make more money with less effort, regardless of market conditions.
  We run several programs that are specifically designed with the farmer or rancher in mind.
  Our mission is to help 25,000 farming and ranching families make a six-figure income from their farm/ranch.
 If interested in this position, please fill out the application here:  https://form.jotform.com/220665538361155
 Who We Can Be Together: 
 We’re going to have incredible teamwork and have a great time achieving our goals and realizing our mission to help grassfed farmers and ranchers flourish.
  We’re going to gain valuable experience and discover and learn amazing insights about how we can best collaborate to accomplish projects as a team.
  Every day we’ll feel energized by the measurable progress we’re making.
  We'll know that as a team, we've covered all areas of need for our members because of our combined conative and cognative strengths and capabilities.
 Success CriteriaThis is how we will measure your success:
 In the first 30 days you will have onboarded all new members with a successful setup of their tech stack.
  You'll work with our other Tech Specialist to make sure that 100% of our current COD clients will have successfully launched their Shopify ecommerce website.
  You’ll respond to support tickets within 18 hrs of submission (M-F) and provide the needed guidance, feedback, direction, assistance to our clients.
  You'll assist on tech calls 1-to-1 each day and on the group Q&A Tech Calls, working alongside our other Tech Specialist to help our members.
  You'll have settled into a smooth communication flow with the Tech & Support Team for optimal tech management for our members needs.

About Pinterest:
Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It's where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you'll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You'll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.

Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that's uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our PinFlex landing page to learn more.
As a Product Support Specialist on the User Support & Operations team, you’ll be the expert for your designated product areas. For your product areas, you’ll ensure a seamless support experience by monitoring KPIs and by partnering with operations, engineering and product teams to ensure readiness for product launches, creating and maintaining internal documentation and sharing user insights to influence product decisions. You are a self-starter who is passionate about the support experience, have an analytical mindset and can effectively communicate to all levels.

What you’ll do:
Own the end to end support experience for your assigned product(s)
Recommend, monitor and continuously improve KPIs related to the support experience for your product areas
Frequently document and share ideas to improve the product and/or support for the product
Create and maintain accuracy of internal documentation relevant to your product areas
Take ownership of solving issues that have been escalated from lower support tiers
Work with User Support and other cross-functional teams (e.g., Product Operations, User Education, etc.) to launch new products and scale our operations
Assist with training. This could include train-the-trainer, helping to create training material or even leading training sessions related to your areas of expertise
What we’re looking for:
Experience working in support and with product and engineering teams
Experience owning and leading cross-functional projects that improve the user experience.
Ability to turn countless support interactions into meaningful insights that can easily be interpreted by product, engineering and operations teams
An effective communicator who can flex their communication style to maximize comprehension and impact
An analytical mindset. Someone with a strong desire and the capability to incorporate data into everything they do
Ability to thrive in an ambiguous, fast paced and dynamic environment

Operations Opportunity in Insurance Industry
   Case Designer, Highland Capital Brokerage
   Location(s): All Locations & Remote
  
   Role Type: Full time
  
   Summary: 
  We currently have an opening for a Case Designer at Highland Capital Brokerage. This position may be a remote position or work in one of our many brick-and-mortar offices throughout the country as a part of a highly collaborative team.
  
   The national team of Case Designers functions as one cohesive unit located across and supporting all of Highland’s geographies, relationships, and customer bases. Each Case Designer acts as a primary support partner for assigned Signature Vice Presidents while also serving as a pool resource for the enterprise. For this reason, Case Designers must be organized and demonstrate an ability to quickly prioritize tasks from multiple sources. Case Designers are a knowledgeable resource who are regularly required to independently leverage their expertise to provide presale assistance including case design, product selection, illustrations, application fulfillment, producer training, etc.
  
   The position requires a self-starter with the drive and autonomy necessary to receive and reply to customer requests while delivering industry leading customer service. Equally as important is a sense of urgency and attention to detail to ensure services provided are prompt, accurate and meet all required compliance and Service Level Agreements guidelines. Case Designers must possess strong written and verbal communication skills in order to provide pertinent information on product recommendations, explanations as to why recommendations were made, as well as guidance regarding the application process, and strategies on how Highland can best support the producer. The Case Designer must be a team player with the ability to work closely with customers, counterparts, and other job families.
  
   The Case Designer position reports jointly to the Sales Support Management Team
  
   Responsibilities: 
  Use proprietary and third-party software solutions to produce life insurance illustrations, revisions, and sales presentations that are both timely and accurate.
    Use communication skills to pinpoint the client needs and deliver a customized solution and alternatives to internal Highland VPs and/or external advisors that consider client objectives, known health history, special funding alternatives, information about competition, carrier specific strengths, etc.
    Solid life insurance product knowledge with the ability to explain technical aspects of product features, benefits, and riders in a clear and concise manner, either in writing or verbally.
    Answer questions regarding competitive product landscape, basic sales concepts, field underwriting, e-solutions, and other resources available at Highland.
    Develop relationships and work with Highland carriers and strategic partners to leverage existing expertise and resources.
    Analyze In-Force details including status, conversion credits, current values, premium schedule, etc. to describe the current disposition of a policy and present alternative solutions.

About Frequence?
   We’re the ones with big ideas, bold vision, and Silicon Valley-casual vibes who are passionate about solving real problems for our clients.
   Frequence’s powerful software makes it easy for media companies to stay competitive in the digital advertising space. We empower experts in sales and ad design with a set of tools that allows them to efficiently deliver what would otherwise be complex advertising strategies.
   Unlike other workflow software, Frequence is the most complete system on the market, connecting all aspects of digital advertising—sales, operations, and reporting—from beginning to end. We create smart, focused campaigns based on performance data from thousands of local and national media campaigns to level the playing field and make programmatic ad buying possible for smaller local businesses. The data is out there, and we want to help advertisers put it to work.
   The Opportunity
   You're a Photoshop wiz, always looking for new tricks and techniques. You’re unafraid of diving into new technology and methodology, while passionate about emerging industries, brands, and design trends.
   As a Jr Photoshop Designer, you help our team create killer digital ads for our partners and clients. As you work with advertisers, large and small, you’ll gain opportunities to help us democratize the design process.

   Create banner designs for our clients using our Adobe Photoshop artboard-based system.
    Conceptualize, storyboard, polish, revise, and deliver products.
    Work seamlessly with a team of designers, client managers, and partners.

   An expert in Photoshop (we like artboards and smart objects). Qualified applicants must complete a proficiency test.
    Aren’t intimidated by a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
    Possess a strong portfolio demonstrating your command of typography and graphic design.
    Have strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
    Leave your ego at the door and enjoy when others do too.
   Nice to Have:
   Eagerness to take ownership
    Passion for other creative pursuits
    Extra skill in:
     Web design
      Print
      Social media design
      Motion graphics
      Video editing
      Audio editing
    
    Loveable, quirky, kids-at-heart welcome :)
  
   Why Frequence?
  
   Frequence is a Top Workplace! Our people-first culture and distinctive mission set us apart from others in the industry. As our company grows, so does our need to add sharp, ambitious, and talented people to our team. We're approachable, inclusive, and encourage open dialogue within our community. This is a place where your voice matters.
  
   Want proof that we love our people? Frequence is proud to be Certified as a Great Place to Work. We are also honored to be recognized by Bay Area News Group as a Top Workplaces Company for 2020 & 2021. And, Frequence ranked as one of the USA's fastest-growing private companies by Inc. Magazine. Join us and let’s see what we can build together.

    Stock options at a mid-stage startup, 401K
    Health, dental and vision insurance coverage
    Generous PTO
