*This position is based remotely from home*
  
  
    The Cardinal Health Pharma ecommerce team is looking for a UX Researcher to help us take our ecommerce platform to the future and beyond. We are looking for a passionate researcher and team player who will be part of a massive digital transformation effort. The UX Researcher will be responsible for uncovering any and all unmet and unstated needs of our users and establishing and maintaining a constant, growing and evolving customer feedback loop.
   
    Accountabilities:
    The UX Researcher will help uncover and define user needs, analyze data gather through various research methods and analytics and validate whether or not digital transformation efforts are meeting the needs of our users. The UX Researcher will work directly with the entire product team across multiple squads to prioritize and specify features to deliver great new experiences.
    Identify the proper research methods needed to best meet the needs of the goals of the problems we are trying to understand
     Conduct or support primary user research studies with business stakeholders and users to gain user insights around met, unmet, stated and unstated needs
     Conduct or support secondary research efforts including analytics, user recordings and feedback, survey results, customer service call logs, internal usage reports, and others
     Validate concepts and prototypes to uncover additional insights and opportunities
     Translate research data gathered into actionable recommendations that help inform future efforts and can deliver recommendations to business partners and leaders in a consumable and delightful manner
     Define user research methods that most effectively inform strategic direction on future and current transformation efforts
     Are familiar with and have used a variety of unmoderated online research tools but are just as comfortable in a moderated setting
     Partner with a digital product team working with UX, UI, product, customer support, technology and other internal business partners
   
    After 90 days you will:
    Have started to establish yourself as the go-to person on the team for all things related to user research, user behaviors, best practices in conducting the right research methods to gain the most insightful user data
     Have participated in several design sessions to help inform squads of the needs of the user
     Have participated design reviews with your teams to provide relevant feedback
     Have (or have started to) aggregate, analyze, share and communicate findings and insights to inform recommendations on the best digital experiences our customers want and need
     Have built/or supported the build of a database of user behaviors, triggers and other data points that can be easily extracted to support design decisions
     Be collaborating with strategic VOC partners and corporate customer insights team on strategic direction to best measure customer sentiment
   
    A year from now you will:
    Have learned enough about our complex business and systems to be able to articulate what you do and why it matters
     Be the go-to person on your team for all things related to user research, user behaviors, best practices conducting the right research to gain the right insights for your projects
     Have conducted several complete research initiatives that have effectively informed strategic direction on future and current transformation efforts such as concept testing, user testing, competitive analysis, persona building, task analysis, user story creation and user experience mapping
     Have formed meaningful relationships across squads and disciplines in the organization through deep collaboration within your product team, with stakeholders, marketing, analytics, online merchandising, IT and other business partners
     Have informed A/B and multi-variate testing, surveys, interviews and other user studies based on research conducted or provided
     Have visited with many of our customers across all the classes of trade
   
    Qualifications:
    Provide a digital portfolio (demonstrating professional research and problem-solving skills)
     Bachelors degree or higher degree in HCI, UX research, cognitive science or other relevant human disciplines, highly preferred or equivalent experience in related field
     3+ years of experience conducting, analyzing, and communicating user research findings and insights
     Expertise in understanding the right methodologies for uncovering user needs and product opportunities
     Can demonstrate having conducted and/or utilized moderated and unmoderated testing methods and tools to gain insights from users
     Travel when needed (~20%) in the future
     Have created and presented your work in multiple formats, in particular slide format (think Powerpoint primarily) to upper management, stakeholders and other business partners in a consumable and enjoyable manner
     Have an understanding of human centric design principles and are passionate about user experiences
     Adaptable to change and are deeply passionate about the user and their experiences, we want people who love to learn new things and challenge themselves
     A Covid-19 vaccination is required in order to be employed in this position. This includes either:
      2 doses of the Moderna or Pfizer vaccine
       1 dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine

    Your Role and Responsibilities
    
      The UX/UI Designer support the Agile transformation of the organization bringing a mix of customer experience design, user experience design and user interface design to work with a range of end users to better understand their needs, and their relationship with the various factors that influence their environment. They gather information from users through qualitative and quantitative methods, including interviews, contextual inquiries, diary studies, personas, card sorting, and usability testing to validate product fit. They leverage an iterative, human-centered approach and solid UI design skills to conceive and deliver valuable new experiences for our clients and colleagues. The UX/UI Designer contribute to all aspects of our process, from research and ideation to delivery with a focus on prototyping and creatively approaching constraints.
     
   
   
    Required Technical and Professional Expertise 
    
     Required Skills:
      1. Gathering and evaluating user requirements, in collaboration with product managers and engineers to deliver intuitive and human centered solutions
      2. Ability to design and conduct user testing and concept validation i.e. identify potential solution options for a stated user need and design experiments that help elicit the most viable solution for users
      3. Experience planning and conducting both quantitative and qualitative user research at all stages of product development
      4. Ability to frame key questions, create research plans to address those, conduct research, and synthesize the findings into meaningful, actionable insights for clients to help them understand how to achieve their business goals and objectives
      5. Plan and implement new designs
      6. Illustrating and designing ideas using storyboards, process flows, service blueprints and sitemaps
      7. Create prototypes for new product ideas
      8. Designing graphic user interface elements and working with UI Kits
      9. Combine creativity with an awareness of the design elements
      10. Optimize existing user interface designs
      11. Test for intuitive experiences
      12. Test new ideas before implementing
      13. Conduct ongoing user research
      14. Passionate about creating value through great design and user experience
     
   
   
    Preferred Technical and Professional Experience 
    
     None.

  About the UX Specialist: 
  The UX Specialist takes charge of devices interaction strategies in synchronization with clients' business goals and user goals. They are the go-to resource for all up-to-date ecommerce design UX knowledge, software etc. Their focus is on all aspects of product management including, useability, function, and marketing. Their job is to focus on the motivation, behavior, and need of a customer to assist the designer in identifying opportunities in a particular market for project solutions. They are responsible for mapping out information and organizing a clear purpose to enhance better communication. They are also expected to develop wireframing that represents different stages or sessions of the project throughout the user journey. After the completion of the project, they must find a way as the lead user experience designer to test products, especially to analyze useability, accessibility, and intrusiveness. 
  About you: 
  We have expectations and so should you. We want to make sure we’re aligned on what is expected from both sides. 
  You’re passionate about eCommerce, technology and/or design. 
   You hold yourself and others accountable. 
   You’re competitive and love winning as a team. 
   You have high standards and expect the same from your team. 
   You understand we're a growing company and everyone wears multiple hats. 
   You understand that there will be “easy weeks” but also “busy weeks” where we need to help each other out. 
   You can work autonomously without being micromanaged. 
  What You’ll Be Doing: 
  Owning all phases of the design lifecycle from user research (primary and secondary) to ideation, design execution, and user testing 
   Designing well thought out experience flows and creating storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas 
   Collaborating effectively with product, engineering, and management teams 
   Iterating based on user feedback and activity, in order to enhance the user experience 
   Mentor existing and new designers on using data and other techniques to improve the usability of their work 
   Incorporate UX/data-driven touchpoints into our existing design process 
   Be responsible for leading the creation of UX-related services and its documentation 
   Strategize New Services 
  Project Related Responsibilities: 
  Full Build Discoveries 
  All strategy deliverables/responsibilities 
    Create Discovery Decks, alongside Solutions Lead 
     Create Site Architecture, with support from Solutions Lead and Developer 
    
   Collaborating with the resource on Creative Direction 
   Any additional, beneficial UX items either within existing or separate deliverables (after auditing our discovery process) 
  Full Build Projects 
  Collaborating with Creative Direction and/or PM on Site Architecture hand-off to project designer 
   Reviewing project designer’s work from a UX perspective 
   Staging site QA 
  MS/Growth X 
  An advisory resource for retainer designs to tap into, as needed 
   Capable of execution (only as an extreme last resort) 
  Your Experience & Skills: 
  2 years of UX/UI design in e-commerce 
   Figma and/or Sketch experience required 
   1-2 years of experience being client-facing 
   1-2 years of User Research and Design Testing experience, preferably in e-commerce 
    Familiar with user testing SaaS and services such as usertesting.com and Maze 
     Familiar with analyzing results and making decisions based on the data 
     Heat Mapping experience is a plus 
     Google Analytics experience is a soft plus 
    
   Shopify Experience is a plus 
   Previous design management and/or mentoring experience is a HUGE plus 
  Compensation & Benefits 
  401K with company matching 
   Remote (Optional / Hybrid) 
   Untracked PTO and sick days 
   Paid holidays 
   Team lunches & dinners (Remote / In-person) 
   Aetna Healthcare, Dental, Vision

Design and build the digital destinations that connect audiences around the world with Disney Parks, Experiences and Products. Every week is different as you collaborate with editorial, creative, and technology teams to create a magical user experience and accessible content across websites, mobile, digital signage, social, email, and more. Bring your creativity and expertise to support everything from major business announcements and global engagement campaigns to new content platforms.
   As the Communications Technology Specialist, you will wear multiple hats as a full-stack designer (UX/UI/HTML/CSS), project manager, and consultant. You will report to the Manager of Communications Technology as part of a specialized team of digital experts amplifying the impact of PR, Public Affairs, and Internal Communications.
   This role is the perfect opportunity to combine your passions for Disney, digital inclusion, and UX/UI design. Your portfolio, skillset, and network will grow as you work across the business to help Disney reimagine the future of external and internal communications. This is a hybrid role with offices at Walt Disney World in Orlando, providing you the flexible scheduling to work both remotely and on-site to stay connected to the magic.
  Responsibilities : 
  Design: Create a magical and inclusive user experience across Communications by translating Disney design frameworks and digital accessibility best practices into wireframes, high-fidelity comps, prototypes, and front-end HTML for a variety of digital platforms and products. Work with developers and technology partners to implement and validate designs.
    Build: Lead project teams or guide content owners in building digital communications, including WordPress websites and HTML emails. For select projects, independently handle content build-out and management.
    Adapt: Continuously grow your knowledge of the global business and stay flexible to deliver on new Communications priorities, including confidential and time-sensitive projects.
    Empower: Build and maintain reusable content templates and building blocks in content creation tools.
    Support: Guide content owners and creators in effective digital communications via project consultation, training, and documentation.
    Innovate: Research new standards, design frameworks, and products as technology evolves to provide forward-thinking solutions.
    Imagine: As a member of the larger DPEP Content Creation and Digital Integration team, be part of the team dreaming up and pitching new ways to engage audiences.
   Basic Qualifications : 
  An online portfolio of digital design and production.
    3+ years’ experience in web design.
    Expertise with industry-standard design and prototyping applications, such as Photoshop, Illustrator, XD, Sketch, InVision, or Figma.
    Expertise building and editing HTML and CSS.
    Fluency with Adobe Creative Cloud applications for media editing and optimization, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and Media Encoder.
    Passion for digital accessibility and inclusion (WCAG, WAI-ARIA, ADA, multi-language)
    Flexible, organized, and motivated to independently manage multiple projects simultaneously. 
   Ability to work collaboratively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to deliver projects.
   Preferred Qualifications:

    Experience incorporating internal style guides or design frameworks into digital content or platforms.
    Experience building and managing sites on WordPress CMS.
    Understanding of website performance, analytics, and SEO.
    Written proficiency in one or more languages in addition to English, such as Spanish, Haitian Creole, or French.

About ConsenSys:

ConsenSys is the software engineering leader of the Web3 space. Our products empower developers, enterprises, and people worldwide to access and build on Ethereum.

Consensys' products are all clear market leaders in their respective markets: MetaMask, Infura, Quorum, Truffle, Codefi, and Diligence. They help power the Ethereum blockchain ecosystem as well as several other Ethereum-compatible protocols, and are poised to grow by orders of magnitude in the coming years. We are seeking a highly-motivated public relations specialist with an interest in the We3 industry and the opportunities it presents people around the world

WHY JOIN CONSENSYS?

Here are some of the perks of being part of a unique organization like ConsenSys

One of the most recognized tech companies in the blockchain ecosystem globally. Work experience at ConsenSys is a tremendous reference for your future career. ConsenSys alumni have moved on to become tech entrepreneurs, CEOs, and team leads at tech companies.

The forefront of a revolution. We fundamentally believe blockchain is a next generation of technology that can lay the foundation for a more just and equitable society. You can be a part of building the digital economy of tomorrow and radically transforming our society for the better.

A dynamic startup environment with deep roots. We are one of the earliest blockchain companies and a leader in the space. You'll join a network of entrepreneurs and technologists that reaches the edge of our ecosystem.

Deep technical challenges. Blockchain technology is just over 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler. There is much to be done before these platforms can scale to the order of millions or billions of users. We are building the tools, infrastructure and applications l that are pushing the technology forward.

Continuous learning and improvements. You'll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas and frameworks from your peers and as you work on different projects — challenging you to stay at the top of your game.

We also champion a remote-first work environment and unlimited holidays.

ConsenSys is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

ConsenSys is aware of fraudulent recruitment practices and we encourage all applicants to review our best practices to protect yourself which can be found here.

   Security Industry Specialists, Inc. (SIS) provides security solutions to some of the most recognized companies and brands in the world. We deliver services that consistently exceed those of our peers. We accomplish this through innovation, constant process improvement, and an uncompromising commitment to hiring, retaining, and rewarding the best talent available. 
   We are a committed team with grand visions developing innovative applications. We are building a set of internal tools to support our employees and manage our day-to-day business operations. This position will be part of a development team working on a web-based platform that is being created completely in-house. The UX/UI Designer will help build a variety of applications for our software suite. 
   Job Responsibilities: 
   Collaborate in a close-knit team of software developers and project/product managers 
   Apply design thinking to deliver intuitive and innovative solutions 
   Conduct methods-based research to identify needs/pain-points 
   Create low-fidelity sketches and wireframes as well as high-fidelity mockups and interactive prototypes 
   Perform usability testing and quickly iterate on alternative solutions 
   Back up your design decisions with both qualitative and quantitative data 
   Create pixel perfect developer-ready assets 
   Leverage, maintain, and expand our existing design system 
   Design for multiple platforms including desktop, tablet, and mobile 
   Perform other duties as assigned 
   The ideal candidate will possess: 
   Bachelor’s Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Centered Design & Engineering, Interaction Design or related field 
   1+ years of industry experience at a software company, interactive agency, design firm, or web publishing environment 
   Fluency in software such as Sketch, Adobe Creative Cloud, InVision, and Zeplin 
   Excellent time-management, communication, technical writing, presentation development, facilitation, and organizational skills 
   Must be a dependable team player with business maturity and enthusiasm with the ability to deliver high level of customer service 
   What we can offer:
  Competitive annual salary $80,000-$90,000 
   Health, Dental and Vision benefits, plus access to dependent coverage and a variety of other benefits 
   Eligibility to contribute to a 401k Plan after the first year of employment 
   Paid Time Off (PTO) 
   A dynamic and challenging work environment 
   Private Detective #11000147227

Who You'll Work With
You will be based in one of our offices in Atlanta, GA, Waltham, MA, Seattle, WA, Chicago, IL or Dallas, TX as part of our Social, Healthcare and Public Entities (SHaPE) practice.
You’ll work with McKinsey’s Center for Societal Benefit through Healthcare as part of our Social, Healthcare & Public Entities (SHaPE) practice. The Center deploys McKinsey’s global capabilities and resources to historically under-resourced areas of healthcare that are critical to the benefit of society, such as mental health and substance use, social determinants of health, rural health, and maternal health. The Center is committed to sharing resources, innovations, data, and findings in the public domain so others can replicate what proves effective.
The Center for Societal Benefit aspires to collaborate with other organizations and leading researchers to drive positive innovation to improve overall health and well-being and reduce healthcare disparities. The Center for Societal Benefit aims to accomplish this objective through four strategies: conducting and sharing research; developing open-access analytic tools and datasets; partnering with organizations to develop novel solutions to longstanding problems; and convening and supporting multi-stakeholder collaborations.
What You'll Do
You will lead the development of open-access analytics tools and datasets within the data hub of McKinsey’s Center for Societal Benefit.
In this role, you will be responsible for product development. You will work with scrum leaders, engineers, designers, and leadership to design prototypes, manage day-to-day development, gather user input and create release plans. You will also be responsible for product strategy. You will work with leadership to define priority development initiatives to support open-access tools and data/analytics partnerships.
You will incorporate product excellence through better UX/UI, performance metrics, user tracking, and competitive analysis. You will also create knowledge initiatives. You will lead the creation of content to provide novel insights on key focus areas (mental health and substance use, social determinants of health, rural health, and maternal heath) in the form of articles, charticles or infographics, and/or conferences.
You will also be responsible for external partnerships. You will lead the collaboration with external partners to co-publish insights, data or interactives on center focus areas. You will set cadence, create content and manage relationships with external partners, working under guidance of leadership.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree
Experience with at least one of the following tools: Domo, Tableau, React, D3, SQL or Python
Excitement to drive impact and improve healthcare outcomes for historically underserved populations
Ability to effectively work cross-functionally
Highly entrepreneurial and driven
Strong analytical skills
COVID-19 vaccination mandate:
Employment with McKinsey & Company, Inc. in the United States and Canada is conditioned on proof of full vaccination against the COVID-19 virus (with a WHO-approved or Health Canada-approved COVID-19 vaccine, as applicable) or approval of an exemption due to a qualifying medical condition or sincerely held religious belief prior to start date.

Central Garden & Pet is looking for a Digital Marketing Specialist for the Dog & Cat businesses supporting Nylabone, Four Paws and Cadet. This role will sit on the E-Commerce and Digital Marketing team reporting into the Digital Marketing Manager, and support SEO, Website Projects, Email Marketing, & Paid Digital Advertising.

ABOUT US
   Gambyt's mission is to make regulated gaming products more relevant and accessible to the world. We are specialists in the lottery industry and create products that deliver life-changing winning moments to players while driving a meaningful impact on state budgets that benefit good causes.
   Through our agile software development practice, we create digital products such as games, loyalty programs, and user experiences that are loved by players. Our team consists of extremely talented product managers, UX/UI designers, software engineers, project managers and quality testers that collaborate closely to achieve our vision.
   We embrace an office-optional approach with headquarters in Ann Arbor, Michigan - the only state in the country where all forms of internet wagering (lottery, casino, sports) have been legalized. Our company is on the ground floor of an industry revolution and we are helping to lead the digital transformation of gaming options in the marketplace.
   JOB DESCRIPTION We are looking for a Junior UX Designer to join our remote team and/or in Ann Arbor, Michigan. In this role, you will collaborate with project managers, graphic designers, developers, and external stakeholders to create fun and engaging digital websites, apps, and games. With mentorship provided from senior staff, your day-to-day will include translating business requirements into functional designs, defining design architecture, implementing clickable prototypes, creating visual styling, and ultimately creating a set of digital products to drive an industry forward. As a Junior UX Designer, you will work to gain a thorough understanding of our industry and become a subject matter expert in the lottery industry and eventually related gaming verticals such as casino and sports. You'll participate in periodic user research and analytics reviews to ensure that designs are meeting business goals. You'll utilize Sketch, Abstract, InVision, Adobe Creative Cloud and other tools to complete your work. We work in an agile framework, delivering new software to the market every two-weeks.REQUIRED SKILLS The successful candidate should possess:
  
   Relevant degree applicable to UX or graphic design 
   Excellent resourcefulness and problem solving abilities 
   Strong interpersonal and communication skills 
   Solid work ethic and team-oriented approach to work 
   A passion for games and digital experiences is a plus
   
   EMPLOYEE BENEFITS Employees will enjoy contributing to a young company that is pioneering the digital transformation of the regulated gaming industry. We work in a casual, collaborative, and fun environment. All full-time employees receive:
  
   Flexibility to work in-office, fully remote, or hybrid 
   Competitive compensation packages 
   Unlimited vacation and personal leave 
   Excellent health and dental benefits, with no premium copays 
   401k program with guaranteed company contribution 
   Company-funded vacation / recreation program 
   Monthly cell phone and computer stipend
   
   Learn more at www.gambyt.com

       About the Department
       
      
       The College of Engineering at NC State University created in the late 1980’s distance education programs to serve the educational needs of the citizens of North Carolina and practicing engineers and computer scientists in the region.
        The Office of Distance Engineering Education, known as Engineering Online, is responsible for the coordination of synchronous and asynchronous classes, registration of students, handling student issues regarding course delivery, student services, marketing of programs, and working with faculty in the development and delivery of classes. The majority of the online students are professional engineers or computer scientists working full time. Student services, quality delivery of online courses, and good communications are vital to the success of online students.
       
     
     
      
       Essential Job Duties
       
      
       The Engineering Online (EOL) webmaster is a crucial team member of the marketing activities for the graduate classes and online degree programs.
        The responsibilities include the maintenance of the EOL website for current and prospective students, the generation of special course marketing pages and course pages, search design optimization, trouble shooting to ensure that all links are working properly, utilizing scripting languages, and designing new pages as needed for the overall operations of the unit.
        
     
     
      
       Other Responsibilities
       
      
       The Webmaster may also need to assist faculty in the placement of course materials on their course websites and help them with the use of a Learning Management System, such as Moodle.

         Job Summary
         
        
         
          Job Summary
         
         
           Eccles IT Group Webmaster
         
         
           The University of Utah David Eccles School of Business, founded in 1917 and educating more than 6,000 students annually, offers eight undergraduate majors, four MBAs, seven other graduate programs, a Ph.D. in seven areas and executive education curricula. The School is also home to nine institutes, centers and initiatives that deliver academic research and support an ecosystem of entrepreneurship and innovation. The Eccles IT Group supports the mission of the Eccles experience to provide a world-class business education with a unique, entrepreneurial focus on real-world scenarios where students put what they learn into practice long before graduation.
          
         
          Located in Salt Lake City, in the foothills of the Wasatch Mountains, the University of Utah is the flagship institution of the State of Utah’s system of higher education and a member of the PAC-12 Conference. Salt Lake City combines the amenities of a major metropolitan area of more than one million people with the friendliness and ease of living of a small, Western city. Seven major ski resorts are within an hour’s drive from campus, and opportunities to pursue activities from biking to hiking to fishing abound. Salt Lake is also home to the Utah Symphony and Opera, the Utah Ballet, several professional ports teams, and a wide range of other cultural and recreational activities.
         
         
       
       
        
         Responsibilities
         
        
         
          Responsibilities
         
         
           The Eccles IT Group provides support to all departments and centers within the David Eccles School of Business. We are looking for a talented and motivated Junior Webmaster to join our team with the fundamental ability to maintain our current sites and the motivation to help us innovate and grow. In this role, you will communicate regularly with our in-house marketing and IT teams to ensure that our websites are performing at the highest level.
         
         Must have strong interpersonal skills and be able to clearly articulate and present website-related processes and procedures to non-technical individuals 
          Must have solid organizational skills and self-motivation to work independently 
          Ability to think “outside the box” to find solutions with limited resources 
          Will work in a fluid environment and coordinate with multiple departments 
          Daily responsibilities may include updating theme and UI/UX design attributes. 
          Weekly duties may include deploying container micro-sites, testing & updating plugins, and SEO analytic analysis. 
          Extended duties may include container image creation, custom theme and plugin creation, web application development, and long-term planning and goal setting. 
          
       
       
        
         Minimum Qualifications
         
        
         Requires a bachelor’s degree or equivalency and 2-4 years of experience. Must have a working knowledge of HTML, JavaScript, and SQL.
         
       
       
        
         Preferences
         
        
         
          Preferences
         
         At least 4 years of experience as a WordPress/PHP developer including: 
           
         
          o Custom theme and plugin development

School Webmaster (PL)
JobID: 10330
Date Posted:
 5/4/2021
Location:
 Plank Junior High School
 Each school will have a designated School Webmaster to manage the school’s website and individual web pages. The Webmaster serves as the school or department's primary contact for questions regarding the website. They also serve to train staff at their location on the use of the website and collaborate with peers to share ideas and innovations. The School Webmaster will be responsible for managing their school’s web page in accordance with School District 308 Web and Communications Standards. The position will pay a stipend (Schedule A, Category 2) and be appointed by the school’s principal.Responsibilities:
Post at least two monthly news stories onto the school’s web page “School News” section.
Update/Change photos and captions on the homepage on a monthly basis
Keep the school website calendar updated (sync Google calendars if maintained/updated by the school office, also add HSO/PTA calendars).
Post important dates (SIP, Early Dismissal, Teacher Institute, Parent/Teacher Conferences, School Closures, School Outages, and Emergency Information) to the yellow banner.
Update Staff Directories at the beginning of the year and maintain throughout the year, update pictures when available.
Annually review and update as needed areas of the website not otherwise assigned to individual users (for example: Announcements, Activities/Athletics, Important Information, Our School, Parent Section, HSO/PTA, Principal’s Message, LRC page).
Annually review and update Teacher section as needed with new staff
Assist staff with updates/development of teacher pages
Notify District Webmaster of teacher changes at each school
Annually review webpages, more often as needed when content changes, for spelling errors, broken links, and outdated information.
Add a date to the bottom of the page if all information has been verified and is accurate (example: Revised 9/19)
Use ALLY tool and repair severe accessibility issues on sites throughout the year:
Monitor school websites, and department and teacher webpages for accessibility issues.
If certain mistakes continually occur, consider a building-wide training to prevent the issue.
When issues are identified, train the user on correct posting/formatting.
Communicate with District Webmaster if accessibility creates an undue burden or fundamental alteration of any academic, athletic, extra-curricular, special education or other programs that uses the website or Internet applications to communicate or provide access to services or informationSocial Media:In coordination with and under the direction of building leaders, webmasters may be responsible for solely managing and posting to the schools’ social media accounts, or assisting as needed.All webmasters should have editing rights to their school’s social media account(s)
All webmasters should be familiar with how to post to the school’s social media accounts
Webmasters should check social media accounts at least every two weeks for fresh content (ideally posts should be made several times per week).
Use online stories or photos if needed, to keep pages current
If building leadership is managing the social media account, and content is not current, please communicate the district’s expectations with building leadership and/or notify district webmaster.
Qualifications:
Some knowledge of HTML, CSS, graphics, W3C, and web standards.
Proficient with Microsoft Office.
Knowledge of Adobe Acrobat Pro0

+5 years of experience in copy writing

  Job summary 
 Do you thrive researching and then crafting great stories that can then be presented to large audiences? We are hiring a storyteller for the AWS Developer Relations which is an incredible opportunity to join an exciting team in Amazon! 
  In this role, you will partner with the Director of AWS Developer Relations, and other executives, to identify, research and craft engaging stories targeting thousands of Developers and other technical audiences. The stories will be delivered in different physical and digital large scale events, video shows and writing blog posts. 
  This role is a combination of researcher/journalist and a ghost writer. You should be skilled in research and interviewing a wide range of subjects, dive deep into details and have a creative growth mindset. You will own projects from the pitch phase through final delivery and will handle writing proposal, as well as logistical coordination, interviewing, scripting, and editing. This is a hands-on position that involves creativity, navigating ambiguity, and providing creative solutions in the moment, all while continuously raising the bar for our team’s storytelling. 
  Your stories will be leveraged in interviews, presented during large events like re: Invent, recorded in the Amazon studios, streamed on Twitch, Youtube, promoted on social media or packaged as a blog post. 
  Key job responsibilities 
 1. Research - similar to what a journalist would do, doing online research, recording the raw information and distilling the key insights. 
 2. Write - Scripts for event keynotes, interviews (interviewer or interviewee), Blog posts, and articles as shadow writer, linked in articles and social media 
 3. Collaborate - Work with video and content stakeholders to develop authentic, and engaging articles, presentations and stories. 
 4. Storytelling - Create compelling stories that connect with hands on builder audiences. Ability to find engaging stories within a cloud technology industry 
 5. Untangle - Navigate and decipher technical developer language into more consumable content. 
 6. Promotion - Capture key, audience targeted messaging for promotional content creation. 
  A day in the life 
 Inclusive Team Culture 
 Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. 
  Work/Life Balance 
 Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. 
  Mentorship & Career Growth 
 Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. 
 Background as researcher journalist

   Responsibilities
  
    Job responsibilities: 
  
  
   The Lead/Executive Producer will be responsible for the day to day management and execution of Production related activities for multiple games in the Microsoft Casual Games portfolio across numerous platforms, including Windows, HTML5/Web, iOS, Android, and others. You will manage the relationships with multiple internal and external development teams, from a remote/work from home work environment. You will own your products from inception to post-launch, including all aspects of the assigned portfolio of products. You will manage a team of internal Microsoft Producers across several projects, balancing and prioritizing the work-load between the producers as well as yourself. You will demonstrate a commitment to exceptional quality and will work closely with Monetization, Design, Marketing, Ad Operations and MCG Leadership teams to deliver results across the portfolio. We are looking for self-motivated individuals that are excited to dream, manage and create the highest quality Casual Games.
  
  
  
    Tasks:
  
  Product Ownership
   Own a set of games to be developed, released and supported across Windows, iOS, Android, Web Platforms and beyond
   Develop new Gameplay patterns for new platforms
    Create performance KPI’s for all assigned products
   Track and Report development efforts and title performance against defined KPI’s
   Create and maintain project tracking documents across all projects
   Manage relationships with internal development partners
   Help make decisions regarding future development partners
   Drive Milestone Acceptance and Partner Work Approval processes
   Prove a commitment to quality, balancing schedule concerns with product quality
  
  Internal Development
   Own the internal development team backlog for a team of 4-10 developers
   Work to prioritize the internal backlog across multiple products, platforms and releases
   Manage day-to-day development with Producers assigned to each product
   Build, Manage & Maintain relationships with internal partners on a variety of initiatives involving Microsoft Casual Games Properties
   Coordinate with Ad Development and Operations teams
   Coordinate with Microsoft Casual Games Marketing team
   Coordinate with Business Development and Legal teams across multiple products
   Coordinate with Business Management team on reporting results
   Work to update, refine, and improve processes and procedures to help all teams work efficiently on multiple fronts simultaneously
   Work to optimize work-flows with partner teams within Microsoft including Test, Loc, UR, Community, User Acquisition, etc.
   Work to optimize work-flows and processes with our external development partners
   Be committed to constant growth and improvement
  
  Leadership and Communication
   Act as a leader within the Microsoft Casual Games Team, consistently demonstrating Microsoft Values
   Deliver success through empowerment and accountability by modeling, coaching and caring.
    Develop full product roadmaps and plans across all assigned titles
   Communicate forward looking plans, current status and past results to Microsoft Casual Games Leadership
   Be accountable and focus on results
   Qualifications
  
    Qualifications and skills
  
  10+ Years’ Experience in App/Game Production/Publishing
   5+ Years’ Experience in Casual and/or Mobile Games Development
   Experience in Mobile App Development/Production
   Solid Communicator with both internal and external partners
   Experience developing, planning, and executing across multiple products, simultaneously
   Thorough knowledge of all phases of Game Development
   Experience working both with internal and external development teams
   Excellent understanding of the game release process on PC and Web
   Experience with analyzing BI to make business & game operations decisions
   Demonstrable expertise in scheduling and prioritization
   Solid Manager, able to directly manage a variety of projects, experience levels, skillsets, and roles
   Ability to build relationships and work well with various disciplines (Development, Design, QA)
   Ability to work cross-organization to get answers for our development team and products
   Demonstrated knowledge of Casual Games competitive landscape & market trends
  
  
    Extra/Bonus Qualifications and skills
  
  Bachelor's degree (+)
   First Party Game Development
   Experience in First-Party Publishing
   Experience with Windows Store apps
   Experience with multi-player/online services
   Experience working in/with remote teams
   Experience releasing on Web/HTML
   Experience developing on new platforms
   Experience in Games as a Service/Live Ops

We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Greenpeace USA is hiring a Web Producer to join our fast-paced, innovative, and dynamic online team and lead web projects within our priority campaigns that will deepen the engagement of our donors, activists, and members in more meaningful ways.
 Greenpeace takes on some of the world's biggest corporations and polluters to stand up for a green future. And we win: just last year, we and our allies stopped Shell from drilling in the Arctic. Business Insider called our campaigning strategy “devastatingly effective.” As the Web Producer, you would be on the frontlines of this strategy, making digital magic happen.
 We're looking for a strong website manager who will ensure a great user experience starting with a functional and attractive digital environment. The Web Producer will also be responsible for building and implementing innovative new tools to better engage our supporters.
 The Web Producer is an exempt, full time, benefits eligible position and will report to the Digital Director who is based in Oakland, CA.
 This position can be located anywhere where Greenpeace is authorized to work in: CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, IL, ME, MD, NV, NY, NC, OR, VA, WA
 The Web Producer will:
 Provide website maintenance and enhancements
  Use a combination of markup languages to write web pages
  Research and implement WP plugins and modules that will improve website structure and usability
  Assist in the development of website redesign plans
  Write functional requirement documents and specifications
  Train staff on website capabilities and usage
  Run consistent site testing and report results out to the online team and other staff as appropriate
  Data reporting from Google Analytics
  Create quality mockups and prototypes on tight timelines
  Create cascading style sheets (CSS) that are consistent across all browsers and platforms
  Maintain graphic standards and branding throughout the product’s interface
  Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies
  Promote usability best practices
  Work collaboratively with the visuals team, online team, and vendors on website and online collateral design
  Lead innovative projects that better engage supporters online
  Represent Greenpeace USA’s website development work both internally and externally, and with global Greenpeace projects / groups when appropriate
 Minimum requirements for this role include:
 At least 3 years experience in front end development or web management with some coding responsibilities
  A strong understanding of industry trends and content management systems such as Drupal and WordPress, as well as software programs like the Adobe Creative Suite.
  Experience with responsive and adaptive design
  Strong understanding of user-focused design principles
  An understanding of the entire web development process in a collaborative environment, including design, development and deployment, with some back-end knowledge
  Knowledge of CRMs and data management
  Proficiency with analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager. And testing tools such as Optimizely, Google Optimize, and Crazy Egg.
 Additional requirements include, but aren’t limited to:
 Comfort with and enthusiasm for working in a fast-paced campaigning environment, including juggling multiple priorities and with people from a wide variety of backgrounds.
  Time management and organizational skills, including experience with project administration
  Excellent written and verbal communications skills.
  Commitment to people-powered campaigning/organizing.
  Strong commitment to the organization’s emphasis on diversity, equity, and inclusion in all aspects of our work.
 COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:
 Greenpeace USA values a healthy work-life balance and has flexible, family-friendly employment policies. Our competitive benefits package for full-time employees includes medical, dental, and vision coverage with low contributions from staff. We have options for pretax flexible spending accounts for medical and dependent care costs. Greenpeace employees enjoy generous 6% 401K matching. New staff members receive 3 weeks vacation, 10 sick days, 2 personal days in their first year. Additionally we are closed Christmas Eve through New Year’s Day.
 After 1 year of service staff members receive 20 weeks of fully paid parental leave and after five years, staff are eligible for a 12 week paid sabbatical. To encourage public transportation use and biking, we offer subsidies for staff who choose to bike or ride mass transit to work. Greenpeace is committed to the growth and development of staff and fostering a creative workplace culture. For more information, check out our benefits plan.
 Only applicants eligible to work and live in the United States without any legal restrictions need apply for this opportunity.
 Salary for this position starts in the $70k range and is commensurate with experience.

Hello Podcast Producers! 
   This is Darko, I’m hiring on behalf of Nate.

I’m looking for a podcast editor to come in and help manage the podcast at a high level. I have an editor that I’ve worked with who can manage that. But looking for your help as a producer to oversee everything and manage more of the process.

  Hard-working and ambitious

  High integrity
  Values being a part of a fast-paced, growth mindset team

  Takes initiative to solve problems BEFORE asked

Software Services by Scientist.com (formerly Notch8) is looking for a driven Project Manager to join our team. We are looking for a talented, motivated problem-solver with good collaboration and organization skills. A successful candidate will have an aptitude for determining and communicating priorities and engaging a team of developers to keep projects on track. Though we are San Diego-based, we have successfully been fully remote since 2007 and are open to candidates in any location in the United States.

Responsibilities:
Support the team by encouraging, coaching, listening, and removing blockers.
Assist in determining requirements, creating tickets and track progress across the boards, especially assuring that items from meeting notes and slack or email get converted into tickets for the team.
Help to control the scope of the project and escalate issues or concerns to other team members.
Work with the team members assigned to current projects in order to complete the project on budget and to meet or exceed expectations.
Organize team retrospectives and project planning meetings.
Contribute to the project schedule and decisions about assigning the right people and other resources to a team.
Work in collaboration with and under the supervision of a senior Project Manager.

Qualifications:

Candidates who meet most but not all requirements for this position are encouraged to apply.
You have strong communication skills, both written and verbal, and can communicate clearly and timely with clients and the team.
You have excellent organizational skills and the ability to effectively plan prior to meetings to ensure they are productive.
You have looked into and are learning to implement various project management philosophies and structures.

Characteristics:
You recognise that a strong team is one which brings together the most diverse group of people.
You create a genuinely inclusive team environment where everyone feels welcome, heard and valued, no matter what their background.
You act as a role model in actively encouraging everyone to value difference, and you’re quick to challenge any behaviors which damage this.
You have an interest in technology and web/mobile applications, and a basic understanding of the technologies Scientist.com Software Services specializes in.

Benefits of Working for Scientist.com:
Dedicated hours allocated to professional development
Being an autonomous member of a collaborative and supportive team
Flexible work hours - we make work-life balance a priority
Work-from-home and remote work options
Comprehensive health, dental, vision and 401K plans
Member of a strong community network in both the local San Diego tech scene and the international Samvera community

Company Overview

Software Services by Scientist.com was started as Notch8 in 2007 with the intent of creating a healthy work environment, focused on quality products and building good relationships, both internally and externally. Today, Software Services is proud of our reputation for leadership in the local tech community, as well as the Ruby and Samvera communities. We believe in a virtuous cycle of happy: happy engineers build great software; great software makes happy clients. We also believe all team members have the right to:
Strong community involvement
Trust, respect, and autonomy
Great work-life balance
Scientist.com was Notch8’s first client, and in 2021 we formally became part of the Scientist.com family. Read more about our shared goals and values at scientist.com/careers/.

Software Services and Scientist.com are committed to maintaining a diverse work environment, which benefits our company and our clients. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider applications without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, physical ability, family status, age, or veteran status.

DriveWealth, the pioneer of fractional equities trading and embedded investing, is a visionary technology company that empowers more than 100 partners around the world to engage their customers by placing the markets in the palm of their hand. We believe the future is fractional, transactional and mobile. Every mobile device should be a gateway to accessing investing and savings products, services, advice, and assistance for global citizens of all ages, wealth stages, and levels of financial expertise. DriveWealth's unparalleled consultative support and cloud-based, industrial strength technology platform allow partners to seamlessly offer branded investing experiences to drive customer acquisition, loyalty, retention, and revenue growth. DriveWealth's commitment to continuous evolution and innovation makes it the partner of choice for powering the future of investing.

Recently completing a Series D raise, DriveWealth's mission is to democratize investing globally by working with partners to invent new ways to use its API-based technology to provide emerging investors with cutting-edge embedded experiences, offer first-time access to U.S. markets, and the ability to begin investing with as little as $1. DriveWealth is committed to empowering consumers around the world to become owners by delivering the most modern brokerage infrastructure, unparalleled industry expertise, and a culture of continued evolution.

 Position Responsibilities
 In addition to the required qualifications, a successful Learning Architect:
 Design, or collaborate with designers, to produce training solutions that meet the requirements of both learners and stakeholders.
  Create detailed design documents, which requires the person to derive primary and secondary course objectives, build measurement and evaluation tools, plan learning activities, identify opportunities for performance support, and determine content needs.
  Partner with subject matter experts, content developers, and multimedia designers to ensure course deliverables match requirements of the training need.
  Conduct content analysis to determine what content currently exists, whether it can be re-purposed to fit the needs of the current project, and the extent to which new content must be developed.
  Create, edit, and coordinate the distribution of assessments, questionnaires, evaluations, surveys, etc.
  Ensures the instructional integrity of course development projects through systematic design and clear writing of scripts, narratives, and storyboards.
  Write and edit content for learning and development projects, including storyboards/outlines, module drafts, practice activities, knowledge checks, evaluation material, and job aids through the application of proven theories of adult learning.
  Utilize current technologies to deliver instructional and/or interactive programs and courses to various browsers across multiple platforms, including mobile devices.
  Build content into online learning modules using course authoring tools. (Articulate Studio, Adobe Captivate, etc.)
 Needs Analysis
 Conduct needs assessments, performance analyses, course content analyses, learner analyses, and job-task analyses in order to select the most appropriate instructional solution to a training-related problem.
  Evaluate the results of training activities using appropriate measurement and evaluation tools: reaction sheets, skill checks, survey, observations, interviews, etc.
  Effectively communicate how training programs and MyTalent reporting work together to support the business needs.
  Recommend training solutions through personal experience and feedback from the clients to improve the current design of offerings.
  Partner with subject matter experts, content developers, and multimedia designers to ensure course deliverables match requirements of the training need.
 Collaboration/Stakeholder Communications
 Work with the MyTalent team to research and resolve MyTalent functionality issues to ensure all training programs developed work properly, are SCORM compliant, and successfully communicate data to MyTalent for compliance and reporting purposes.
  Establish and maintain reporting processes while partnering cross- departmentally with stakeholders and experts in IT, HR, etc. to maintain client data feeds for strategic alignment and support.
  Proactively troubleshoot MyTalent to ensure issues within the system are identified and resolved promptly in order to provide customer service and technical/functional expertise to internal clients and support staff.
  Maintain a persistent line of communication with the MyTalent team to pursue any outstanding technical issues with the MyTalent system that may need to be escalated to the LMS vendor.
 Outcome Measurement
 Evaluate the results of training activities using appropriate measurement and evaluation tools: reaction sheets, skill checks, survey, observations, interviews, etc.
 Clinical/Professional Development
 Pilot and audit courses in order to determine opportunities for updates and improvement.
 Consultation
 Consult with internal clients and subject matter experts tasked with training and development to advise, guide, coach, negotiate, and manage the development of performance-based training.
  Collaborate with Learning Technology and Leadership & Professional Development teams to support implementation of training.
 Why Texas Health As a Texas Health Learning Architect you’ll enjoy top-notch benefits including 401(k) with match, paid time off, competitive health insurance choices, healthcare and dependent care spending account options, wellness programs to keep you and your family healthy, tuition reimbursement, a student loan repayment program and more.
 At Texas Health, our people make this a great place to work every day. Our inclusive, supportive, people-first, excellence-driven culture make Texas Health a great place to work.

Are you looking to elevate your cyber career? Your technical skills? Your opportunity for growth? Deloitte's Government and Public Services Cyber Practice (GPS Cyber Practice) is the place for you! Our GPS Cyber Practice helps organizations create a cyber minded culture and become stronger, faster, and more innovative. You will become part of a team that advises, implements, and manages solutions across five verticals: Strategy, Defense and Response; Identity; Infrastructure; Data; and Application Security. Our dynamic team offers opportunities to work with cutting-edge cyber security tools and grow both vertically and horizontally at an accelerated rate. Join our cyber team and elevate your career. 
   Work you'll do 
  Support clients with data protection, IoT, and overarching cloud capabilities. 
   Implement core and cloud infrastructure security to manage risks and exposure. 
   Perform cyber reconnaissance to illuminate a potential attack surface area. 
   Provide threat and vulnerability management to federal clients and teams. 
   Analyze tactical network architectures and topologies to assess security risks.
   The team 
   Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of more than 15,000 professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise
   At Deloitte, we believe cyber is about starting things-not stopping them-and enabling the freedom to create a more secure future. Cyber Infrastructure is focused on rethinking how security is integrated across modernized infrastructure as cyber threats become more complex. If you're seeking a career implementing, architecting, and-in select cases-handling next generation controls to manage security risks and exposure, then the Cyber Infrastructure team at Deloitte is for you.
   Qualifications 
   Required:
  Bachelor's degree required 
   Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future 
   Must be able to obtain and maintain the required clearance for this role 
   Provide technical leadership to engineering teams, designing network and enterprise communications 
   Perform ongoing technology and infrastructure assessments and make recommendations to maximize system performance. 
   Architect UC solutions that require advanced network and enterprise UC design knowledge following industry best practices for multi-vendor environments with successful interoperability integrations 
   Provide design consultations and architecture related guidance for infrastructure deployment, migration from existing ISDN setup to achieve the functionality of Audio, Video, IM, Screen share, Web and video conferencing encompassing both Vendors Cisco and Microsoft's UC solutions and facilitating the interwork between the two without the loss of functionality 
   Understand the SaaS capabilities (e.g. O365) so clients can optimize against detailed technical and business requirements. 
   Determine, document, and recommend options to enable data integration and management between disparate processes, systems and infrastructure, including in the Cloud, and On-premise systems that provide the desired functionality. 
   Provide expert knowledge, skill, and ability in multimedia collaboration engineering and design.
   Preferred:
  Prior professional services or federal consulting experience 
   Previous Security Operations Center experience 
   Experience in mobile and endpoint security 
   Certifications (e.g., CompTIA Security+, CEH, CISSP)

Job Classification:
Corporate - Human Resources
Prudential’s Global Technology team is the spark that ignites the power of Prudential for our customers and employees worldwide. Our organization plays a critical and highly visible role in delivering customer-driven solutions across every area of the company. The Global Technology team is made up of diverse, agile-thinking, and highly-skilled professionals; we use our combined capabilities to enable the organization with innovation, speed, agility, scalability and efficiency.
The Global Technology team takes great pride in our culture where digital transformation is built into our DNA. When you join the Global Technology organization at Prudential, you’ll unlock a challenging and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading financial services institutions.
We are seeking a Technical Learning Architect, to be an innovative, collaborative team member in the Global Technology Learning team. This organization is dedicated to creating a talent pool of ready-now leaders and driving employee engagement with workforce learning strategy and curricula that support career mobility and enterprise thinking for Global Technology. This position will report directly to the Director of Learning in the Global Technology organization and will be responsible for creating learning solutions that support Global Technology strategy including Agile, Cloud, Data, Dev Ops, AI ML, Automation, and Innovation.
An ideal candidate has experience developing technical training as part of upskilling/reskilling programs, is agile and intellectually curious, and is able to influence and provide thought leadership in their domain of expertise while effectively navigating ambiguity and driving business outcomes with a learner centric mindset. The individual must demonstrate business acumen and possess a passion about learning and enhancing learner engagement. Additionally, the ability to build outstanding and constructive working relationships with key stakeholders and foster an inclusive environment will be critical.
Your Role
This role is responsible for the design and development of end-to end-learning solutions in a variety of formats including instructor-led, virtual, eLearning, infographics, simulations, case studies, videos, assessments, games, visual elements, and other digital and non-digital learning solutions while employing a rapid design process. You will work jointly with other members of the learning team and SMEs to identify the course goals and objectives that embrace human-centric design. You will also be responsible for creating program evaluations and assessments based on course objectives to determine effectiveness of training. You will manage multiple projects simultaneously and working under aggressive time frames to meet production deadlines.
Responsibilities:
Develop and implement technical skills training solutions for upskilling/reskilling programs aligned to Global Technology strategy and goals.
Design and develop end to end learning solutions using workplace learning authoring tools, including emerging technologies; Articulate 360, Vyond, Adobe Creative Cloud, Axonify, and other authoring programs to develop rich learning solutions. Able to use variables, triggers, and appropriate media to develop unique learning experiences.
Experience working with multimedia production in the design, capture and production of video and audio.
Consult and make recommendations on instructional methods appropriate for content and learner characteristics.
Collaborate with learning partners, peers, subject matter experts, facilitation team, and operational leaders to create learning experiences that demonstrate sound adult learning strategies, produce learning outcomes, and develop targeted skills among learners.
Design in an agile, iterative fashion, with a mix of collaborative team ideation and focused, self-directed design time.
Scope and estimate level of effort for project deliverables.
Consult with other learning developers on strategies to incorporate video, audio, media streaming, and blending media for engagement through embedded storytelling.
Evaluate learning programs for effectiveness and continuously improving solutions.
Apply strong project management discipline for setting expectations, execution, and resolving issues.
Upload and test digital learning solutions accessibility within the Learning Management System.
Utilize strong project management discipline for setting expectations, execution, and resolving issues.
Foster an inclusive environment of continuous learning and development.
Create strong working relationships with peers and business leaders across the enterprise and across HRBPs, HR CoEs, HR Operations, and Inclusive Solutions.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience preferred (e.g. Instructional Design, Instructional Technology, Adult Learning, Educational Design, ISD, or related field).
Financial services industry knowledge and experience preferred.
Optimally 3+ years working with Technology clients within the financial services industry.
Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally in a highly matrixed environment.
Minimum 5 years of instructional design for ILT, WBT, virtual classroom and simulations.
Deep understanding of skills and competencies-based technology learning platforms (e.g., Pluralsight) as well as experiences implementing them and building out custom learning paths, preferred.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Strong organizational skills.
Experience working with multimedia production in the design, capture and production of video and audio.
Competencies – Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
Learning Solutions Development : experience working with workplace learning authoring tools, including emerging technologies. Specific experience with LMS, Articulate 360, Adobe Creative Cloud, and other authoring programs to develop rich WBTs and simulations. Able to use variables, triggers, and appropriate media to develop human-centric learning experiences.
Workplace Learning & Development Expertise: demonstrated expertise in L&D, with a high degree of competency with adult learning principles and learning models; experience in curriculum development, instructional design, planning, facilitation, and implementing efficient learning solutions; proven success developing learning strategy and aligning leadership support.
Graphic Design: experience working with graphic design using Photoshop, Illustrator, Flash, and graphic design theories. Able to create custom graphics, color themes, style guides, infographics, and templates that enhance learner engagement and knowledge application.
Storytelling: ability to socialize and adapt our learning value story to leaders at all levels of the organization
Business Acumen: understands the strategic business needs of the company and the impact of learning on meeting the development needs of employees to best serve our customers; leverages external marketplace research and business insights to drive outcomes.
Influence with Impact: successfully affects / influences leaders and employees to adopt innovative learning solutions that drive business outcomes; possesses a consultative mindset and leverages a combination of impeccable verbal and written communication skills, highly developed emotional intelligence, and data fluency to drive decision-making.
Relationship Building and Interpersonal Skills: builds outstanding and constructive working relationships with key stakeholders and business leaders at all levels across the organization, as well with peers and colleagues; organizationally savvy with a learner centric mindset; desires to collaborate and successfully operates across the organization.
Inclusion and Diversity: focuses on creating an environment of honesty, inclusion, and respect for others; champions differing ideas and perspectives; embraces a creative, innovative approach to developing employees with a strong appreciation of our diverse employee and customer base.
