Deutsch NY is looking to immediately fill an Editorial and Content Strategist.

You're a senior content designer, UX writer or content strategist. You might also go by the name of information architect, UX designer, information designer, technical writer, or editor. You wear many hats. You're OK with that.

You have an eye for good design and an ear for good writing. You think in patterns, always seeing the systems behind things (or the lack of them). You habitually find ways to make things work faster and smarter, whatever challenge you're working on. You're creative and can see many points of view at once. You're ambitious and passionate about what you do. And you always put the user's needs first.

The Editorial Strategy & Content Strategist is responsible for cultivating and advancing the editorial vision for one of our largest clients, a Fortune 500 financial institution. As stewards for the brand, its purpose, and its role in consumers lives - our Content Strategist is tasked with connecting that larger vision and tone to be consistent throughout content being created across properties and touchpoints. You will be directly responsible for the oversight and management of our ongoing content publishing; chairing work both produced externally, and work produced by our diverse and dedicated creative teams who are supported by an array of strategists and community managers.

You would self-describe as someone who enjoys working at both the macro and the micro level. In this role, you will establish strong editorial perspectives and tones across various lines of business, while still being interested in diving deep into the analytics to figure out what made a piece of content so sticky. We have a wide array of internal stakeholders that we service in this role, many for whom content marketing is a new philosophy. They look to us as guides and trust our recommendations, though some handholding can be required from time to time. This role is ideal for someone who has a choice curatorial eye, is interested in or has experience in the financial space, is obsessed with the potential of Venmo, loves a good Vox Explainer video, or who listens to Planet Money on the side.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Brief, lead and facilitate teams in the development of content that align with the brand vision, the target audience, and the client's business objectives
Lead or facilitate teams through the briefing process with creative teams
Brief, Lead or facilitate teams through the articulation of consumer and behavioral insights in partnership with our data and media teams; researching to craft action or content plans focused on getting results.
Serve as a central knowledge point for our agency and clients understanding of content marketing and editorial
Be an active partner with our agency's analytics and media team to monitor the progress of digital campaigns and establish accurate benchmarking and critical metrics
Lead the collaboration process between the digital strategy, account, and planning departments - working as a cohesive unit to set a new bar for the work going out of the agency
Idea architecture: Collaborate with creative, digital production and UX team members to write and present idea platforms and overall communication plans as needed
Be an active leader with a point of view on the standard methodologies for content marketing
Be a vocal participant in financial aspects of the account including: budget, staffing, projections, etc.
Establish relationships with client contacts at all levels to be the voice of the agency in presenting and selling a creative strategy
WHAT YOU'VE GOT
Ability to switch between high-level thinking and detailed content planning
A firm understanding of user experience and strong search engine optimization (SEO) and search engine marketing (SEM) skills
5-7 years in relevant work experience, including at least 4 years immersed within the content strategy or editorial space
Strong relationship management skills, and ability to work as a strategic advisor to partners within the organization
Ability to be an actively creative thinker and problem solverAbility to compellingly communicate a brand's story paired with a design sensibility to envision how content will be presented or distributed in formats other than text-based articles, such as infographics or multimedia presentations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience leading on content, editorial, or other strategic efforts end-to-end
Ability to craft strong social and content strategies independently, or effectively leading a team to do so
Deep experience developing performance metrics, and working with analytics teams to ensure that campaign goals are being met, and that social/digital activities were effective
Conversant in current consumer behaviors and relevant industry trends
Ability to craft and deliver strong presentations
Interest and excitement in the consumer financial space a plus, but not required
WHAT WE'VE GOT (that you can't find out on the internet)
We're nice people. Seriously. Some of the most ego-less and collaborative people you'll find in this business.
We're evolving fast. Sure, every agency will claim that, but we're surfing a wave of new biz wins, new ways of working and new Deutsch that prove it. Hopefully you'll be one of them.
We take our work seriously but believe weekends, vacations and thinking space outside the office make you better at your job, not worse.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: 
  Seattle, WA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA.
   Minimum qualifications:
   10 years of technical writing experience. 
   3 years of experience as an Information Architect or Content Strategist.
   Preferred qualifications:
   Technical knowledge and aptitude, with technical writing skills. 
   Ability to influence and persuade others without direct authority. 
   Ability to independently lead, communicate, and collaborate with business partners and work effectively with global teams. 
   Ability to read and understand source code written in Java, C++, Python, or JavaScript. 
   Ability to deliver communications and documentation in the format best suited for diverse audiences. 
  
   About the job
    Technical writers plan, create, and maintain educational content as an integral part of the engineering or user experience. The content is often in the form of documentation, but may also be UI text, sample code, videos, or other educational material. Regardless of the content medium, technical writers are distinguished by their abilities to explain complex topics in a way that’s useful to their audience. 
   As a Technical Content Strategist, you will have a significant leadership role and influence on documentation development in several product areas and collaborate closely with executive business partners. You will define a holistic content strategy for a variety of user experiences or multimedia approaches by defining the problem, setting goals, helping implement solutions, and measuring effectiveness. 
   You will assist and mentor Technical Writers and Product Managers to identify the top topics in their product areas and design use cases with supporting assets such as text, tutorials, and videos. You will collaborate with information architects to ensure that our information architecture improves usability, discovery, and access for users. 
   Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
  
  
    Responsibilities
   Evolve a content strategy to create a well-lit path for Google Cloud Platform developers across multiple user journeys through analytics of content usage, customer engagements, feedback from executive business partners, competitor analysis, and research of next-generation technologies. 
    Collaborate with other teams to define the front-end and back-end requirements that are needed to evolve content strategy. 
    Work closely with the other Content Strategists to create organization-wide strategic programs. 
    Contribute to strategic initiatives around authoring processes, content management, content navigation, and content taxonomy. 
    Audit the existing content in your product area, perform gap analysis, and determine how to present new and existing content in compelling ways to customers. 
   Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

About Avaya 
    
    
      Businesses are built by the experiences they provide, and every day millions of those experiences are delivered by Avaya Holdings Corp. (NYSE: AVYA). Avaya is shaping what's next for the future of work, with innovation and partnerships that deliver game-changing business benefits. Our cloud communications solutions and multi-cloud application ecosystem power personalized, intelligent, and effortless customer and employee experiences to help achieve strategic ambitions and desired outcomes. Together, we are committed to help grow your business by delivering Experiences that Matter. Learn more at www.avaya.com. 
    
   
   
    
      ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY 
    
    
      Applicants must already be located in the U.S. and roles are not eligible for sponsorship. The Senior Customer Experience Consultant creates, evaluates, modifies and optimizes user interfaces across all types of voice and digital communication channels to address the enterprise-wide opportunities of Avaya customers. To be successful in this role you will be a self-starting team player designing and driving collaborative, multi-channel solutions, while establishing and applying best practices in software design, usability processes, grammar development and application tuning in support of the optimal user experience.
      
     #LI-LD1 
     #LI- Remote 
    
   
   
    
      ABOUT THE RESPONSIBILITIES 
    
    
     Works as a trusted advisor with the customer in identifying business problems and use cases across multiple communication technologies including Social Media, Async Messaging, Video, Chat, Email, SMS, and Voice. 
      Provides thought leadership in the strategic design process and translates business needs into optimal user interface designs, preparing user interface documentation for developers and assisting with development of test plans 
      Enhances existing systems by analyzing and identifying areas for improvement/modification 
      Possesses project leadership responsibilities for complex projects 
      Assists in establishing and applying software design/usability best practices for user interfaces 
      Meets customer and business goals as an individual and a member of a cross functional project team 
      Gathers and analyzes caller and business requirements used to design successful applications 
      Creates user interface requirements documents, functional specifications and other business related documents 
      Develops and presents call flow and messaging to accomplish business and caller satisfaction goals 
      Consults with (internal and/or external) customers on the branding of custom applications (including, for example, analysis of a customer’s marketing strategy and touch-points) resulting in the development of corresponding personas 
      Helps customer select voice talent in line with the persona developed. Coaches voice talent during message recording sessions. 
      Collaborates with solution architects and developers to ensure compliance with application design objectives 
      Provides usability support to product teams, including the analysis and investigation of applications/systems, including graphical, web, multimedia, voice response, and conversational user interfaces 
      Develops ASR lexicons, TTS dictionaries, simple and complex ASR grammars, including SSM/SLM grammars. 
      Supports and executes speech application tuning optimization including both speech-recognition and caller experience optimization 
      Supports and executes TTS tuning to optimize segment selection and transitions 
      Exercises judgment in methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining exceptional results 
      Collaborates closely with other team members in a virtual work environment 
      Demonstrates problem-solving and lateral thinking as part of a team, or individually 
      Contributes to the development of company objectives and principles and achieves goals in creative and effective ways 
      Shares new knowledge and lessons learned as training for other team members 
      Mentors others as a technical subject matter expert 
      Translates complex concepts and designs into simple to follow examples 
     
   
   
    
     ABOUT THE REQUIREMENTS 
    
    
      EXPERIENCE: 
     Proven applied experience with user-centric human factors design best practices
      Background with voice-enabled applications a plus.
      
     SKILLS & COMPETENCIES: 
     Must be comfortable speaking/presenting content
      Must be detail oriented.
      Time management and self-management skills expected.
      Must be effective in a virtual working environment.
      User Interface Design, Human Factors Engineering, and Dialog Design skills expected.
      Must have a strong customer focus
      Ability to present oneself in a professional manner at all times.
      Cross-organizational effectiveness and thought leadership.
      Knowledge of VXML, SRGS and SISR standards, lexicon development, GRXML grammar development, usability testing, voice biometrics and/or speech application tuning is a plus.
      
     ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: 
     Excellent English oral and written skills; additional language competency or linguistics background a plus.
      Up to 25% travel may be required occasionally.
      
     EDUCATION/QUALIFICATION: 
     Requires a Bachelor's degree in Human Factors Engineering, Computer Science, Computational Linguistics, Business Processes/Analysis, or a related field, plus proven work-related experience.
     
   
   
    
      COMPENSATION - SECTION PERTAINS TO COLORADO RESIDENTS ONLY 
    
    
      (Colorado only*) Minimum salary of $107,000.00 + bonus + benefits. 
     Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado. 
     
   
   
    
     EXPERIENCE 
    
    
     
      5 - 8 Years of Experience
     
    
   
   
    
      FOOTER

They look to us as guides and trust our recommendations, though some handholding can be required from time to time. This role is ideal for someone who has a choice curatorial eye, is interested in or has experience in the financial space, is obsessed with the potential of Venmo, loves a good Vox Explainer video, or who listens to Planet Money on the side.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Brief, lead and facilitate teams in the development of content that align with the brand vision, the target audience, and the client’s business objectives
Lead or facilitate teams through the briefing process with creative teams
Brief, Lead or facilitate teams through the articulation of consumer and behavioral insights in partnership with our data and media teams; researching to craft action or content plans focused on getting results.
Serve as a central knowledge point for our agency and clients understanding of content marketing and editorial
Be an active partner with our agency’s analytics and media team to monitor the progress of digital campaigns and establish accurate benchmarking and critical metrics
Lead the collaboration process between the digital strategy, account, and planning departments - working as a cohesive unit to set a new bar for the work going out of the agency
Idea architecture: Collaborate with creative, digital production and UX team members to write and present idea platforms and overall communication plans as needed
Be an active leader with a point of view on the standard methodologies for content marketing
Be a vocal participant in financial aspects of the account including: budget, staffing, projections, etc.
Establish relationships with client contacts at all levels to be the voice of the agency in presenting and selling a creative strategy
WHAT YOU’VE GOT
Ability to switch between high-level thinking and detailed content planning
A firm understanding of user experience and strong search engine optimization (SEO) and search engine marketing (SEM) skills
5-7 years in relevant work experience, including at least 4 years immersed within the content strategy or editorial space
Strong relationship management skills, and ability to work as a strategic advisor to partners within the organization
Ability to be an actively creative thinker and problem solverAbility to compellingly communicate a brand’s story paired with a design sensibility to envision how content will be presented or distributed in formats other than text-based articles, such as infographics or multimedia presentations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience leading on content, editorial, or other strategic efforts end-to-end
Ability to craft strong social and content strategies independently, or effectively leading a team to do so
Deep experience developing performance metrics, and working with analytics teams to ensure that campaign goals are being met, and that social/digital activities were effective
Conversant in current consumer behaviors and relevant industry trends
Ability to craft and deliver strong presentations
Interest and excitement in the consumer financial space a plus, but not required
WHAT WE’VE GOT (that you can’t find out on the internet)
We’re nice people. Seriously. Some of the most ego-less and collaborative people you’ll find in this business.
We’re evolving fast. Sure, every agency will claim that, but we’re surfing a wave of new biz wins, new ways of working and new Deutsch that prove it. Hopefully you’ll be one of them.
We take our work seriously but believe weekends, vacations and thinking space outside the office make you better at your job, not worse.

Since 1983, when it launched the Nintendo Entertainment System™, Nintendo has sold billions of video games and hundreds of millions of hardware units globally, including Nintendo Switch and the Nintendo 3DS family of systems, as well as the Game Boy™, Game Boy Advance, Nintendo DS™ family of systems, Super NES™, Nintendo 64™, Nintendo GameCube™, Wii™, and Wii U™ systems. It has also created industry icons that have become well-known, household names, such as Mario, Donkey Kong, Metroid, Zelda and Pokémon. Job Description
   Are you a power and performance (PnP) expert who thrives on identifying and solving complex system level issues? Would it excite you to find new ways to move PC performance to break current standards? Do you like working with a team of architects that may challenge your current thinking?In this role, you will have the opportunity to engage with key external partners and customers, both from an operating system as well as a hardware perspective, to influence future products. You will develop new innovative features to increase battery life and performance on the latest generation of PC platforms, collaborating closely with internal CPU and platform architects and design engineers to implement unique Intel specific features. You will have the opportunity to develop your in-depth technical understanding of PC hardware and software to further optimize PnP. This role works with our architects to define PnP workloads, metrics, measurement methodology and platform projections and works across organizational boundaries to articulate solutions to senior management and to external parties.Our roles also provide an excellent opportunity to develop cutting edge features for graphics, multimedia, and low-power domains, in close collaboration with the operating system vendor and customers. Candidates with excellent hands-on skills in kernel feature development, firmware, multimedia, graphics, imaging/camera or artificial intelligence background interested in exploring working at system level are ideal.This is a great opportunity for PnP experts to help define the future of PCs. Our hiring managers are reviewing resumes daily and reaching out to candidates quickly. Apply Now!It is all up to you, your imagination and Intel!
  
   Qualifications
   You must possess the minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or similar technical STEM degree 6+ years of industry experience 4+ years of experience with the following: C/C++ programming Power and Performance (PnP) OS experience either on Windows, Linux or Chrome Preferred Qualifications: In addition to the minimum requirements, three plus years of experience with any of the following: Technical leadership experience and decision-making skills with ability to influence a large technical team Experience designing innovative solutions to complex problems Experience with technical concepts, architecture, systems, development methods, and disciplines associated with defined projects, applies that knowledge to deliverables, and leverages it to accelerate project completion Working with teams across different Geos Hands-on skills in one of the following domains: kernel feature development, firmware development, validation, integration, debugging, or PnP optimization. Knowledge of computer architecture Agile teams Computer architecture Power management and/or performance frameworks, including debug analysis
  
   Inside this Business Group
   The Client Computing Group (CCG) is responsible for driving business strategy and product development for Intel's PC products and platforms, spanning form factors such as notebooks, desktops, 2 in 1s, all in ones. Working with our partners across the industry, we intend to continue to advance PC experiences to deliver the real-world performance people demand. As the largest business unit at Intel, CCG is investing more heavily in the PC, ramping its capabilities even more aggressively, and designing the PC experience even more deliberately, including delivering a predictable cadence of leadership products. As a result, we are able to fuel innovation across Intel, providing an important source of IP and scale, as well as help the company deliver on its purpose of enriching the lives of every person on earth.
   Other Locations US, California, Folsom;US, California, Santa Clara
  
   Intel strongly encourages employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Intel aligns to federal, state, and local laws and as a contractor to the U.S. Government is subject to government mandates that may be issued. Intel policies for COVID-19 including guidance about testing and vaccination are subject to change over time.
  
   Posting Statement All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.
  
   Work Model for this Role
   This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

   How exciting would it be to be a part of the innovation that goes into creating technology that delights millions of people in an industry that’s here to stay! The SME in the network intelligence knowledge domain.

    Create configuration standard document
    Create test plan & report document

    Advanced knowledge and working experience with RADIUS, Diameter, access control, DPI, policy control, Netflow, IPFIX, IPDR, content filter, traffic shaping and policy enforcement solutions
    Advanced knowledge or experience on Sandvine PTS, SPB, SDE, Sand Script development, RCRF, Quota manager, Active Logic, Maestro Policy Engine, Depp Insights, etc.

    Exceptional documentation skills that can clearly articulate technical designs, issues and constraints, procedures, and network assessments
    Strong communication skills and a positive attitude

    Excellent problem-solving skills and thorough knowledge of network
    Self-motivated, Self-Reliant, Self-Starting, Go-Getter, Attitude of ownership, and A strong desire to learn
    Works well in an engineering environment that requires communication and collaboration with fellow team members, and cross function teams
    Bachelor’s degree or above in Computer Engineering/Computer Science
    10+ years of experience in network service engineering design, and implementation as applied to complex computing systems
    More than 8 years of business intelligence solution development experience

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

TRC Companies, Inc. a pioneer in ground-breaking scientific and engineering developments since the 1960s, is an engineering consulting firm that provides integrated services to the energy, environmental and infrastructure markets. TRC serves a broad range of clients in government and industry, implementing complex projects from initial concept to delivery and operation.

SECTOR OVERVIEW

Our Environmental Sector delivers comprehensive environmental solutions to meet the full project lifecycle needs of clients in renewable energy, oil & gas, transportation, and manufacturing industries. With one of the largest multimedia air and land permitting and compliance teams in the country, we support client success in manufacturing and industry, liquids delivery and processing, natural gas storage and delivery, power generation and delivery, and transportation projects.

POSITION SUMMARY

TRC is soliciting applications from highly motivated, qualified individuals to fill a Landscape Architect / Designer position in our firm. The Landscape Architect position will have an emphasis in site/civil/engineering, environmental planning, and permitting for a variety of projects and clients in the areas of energy, utilities development, and transportation.

The Landscape Architect/Designer may report to offices in Lyndhurst, New Jersey, Clifton Park, Ithaca, Liverpool, or West Seneca, New York, or several of TRC’s offices in the state of Pennsylvania.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & TASKS
The successful applicant will be involved in a wide variety of projects including renewable energy projects, electric generation and transmission, and pipeline projects and will be helping to advance the landscape architecture services and abilities of the firm.
Perform time sensitive work for submission and permitting purposes.
Ability to collaborate directly with a variety of professional team members internally to ensure that each assignment follows the project scope, schedule, and budget.
The position may entail short-term field assignments; therefore, the candidate must be willing and physically able to travel and work outdoors in rough and remote terrain under challenging environmental conditions; and have a valid driver's license and an acceptable driving record.
Preparing Landscaping Plans for Land Development Submissions.
Interpreting state and local planning and zoning ordinances.
QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Registered Landscape Architect.
A strong working knowledge of native plant species, pollinator-friendly plant species, and/or pollinator initiatives.
Experience with vegetation management plans and/or forest conservation plans.
Experience using 3ds Max 3-D modeling software is a plus.
Experience with consultation and coordination with federal and state agency processes.
An understanding of construction-related erosion and sedimentation control practices, stormwater planting concepts, wetland delineations, and natural resource inventory.
Preference will also be given to applicants that have experience working on energy, renewable, and transportation projects, as well as solid experience with state and local permitting and siting.
TRC is an equal opportunity employer: disability/veteran. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

TRC offers advancement potential and a competitive compensation and benefits package including a 401k plan with a company match. For more information, please visit our website at http://www.trccompanies.com/.

Good storytelling starts with great listening. At Audible, that means each role and every project has our audience in mind. Because the same people who design, develop, and deploy our products also happen to use them. To us, that speaks volumes.
   ABOUT THIS ROLE
   As a Software Development Engineer, it’s up to you to define, design and refine the tech that keeps us one step ahead of listeners. Anticipate. Innovate. Bring challenging ideas and we’ll support you with the latest tech, tools, and systems that you need to succeed. We pride ourselves on our ability to imagine and invent solutions to problems of the future and you’ll be essential in this forward-thinking approach to development. Together with the team, you’ll build and maintain our platform to bring thousands of stories to millions of listeners and unleash the power of the human voice.
   ABOUT THE TEAM
   The Consumer Domain team creates and powers Audible’s websites and services for our global listeners. We are the home for tech talent that wants to grow Audible’s market leading business and build the web applications and services (APIs) across desktop and mobile devices. The team is comprised of developers who work in an agile environment and partner closely with Audible and Amazon tech teams, Product, UX and QA teams.
   We are embarking on a mission to reshape the fundamental experiences and delight our customers and drive a strong engineering culture. It's our responsibility to push Audible into new places; wherever our customers are listening. Achieving this vision means expanding and strengthening our development process, delivery execution and leveraging new technologies to deliver services and web solutions. We need your help to develop and deliver on this vision. Success means we lay the foundation for continued expansion of our company without disrupting an already tremendously successful and much loved project.
   ABOUT YOU
   You are an innovative and passionate top software engineer looking to make a positive impact on customer experience. You like to own deliverables end-to-end and have a meaningful influence on the final product. You are a builder. You like to work with fellow engineers and product people to share knowledge, imagine, design, develop, test, and launch software that wows our community and inspires our peers. You're curious and love to learn unprompted as you stay up to date with tools, trends, technologies and best practices in the industry. You have an interest in Web Application, Services Design & Architecture, SEO, Security, SNS, Lambda, S3, CloudWatch, REST services and Javascript. Please don't hesitate to apply!
   As a Software Development Engineer, you will...
  Develop web solutions and services: Envisioning, designing, creating, and supporting our solutions that operate with a high degree of operational excellence.
   Partner with a cross-functional team to imagine, design, develop, test, and launch software that wows our community and inspires our peers.
   Explore technical needs and bring problems AND solutions to the table.
   Constantly strive to raise the bar on engineering excellence.
   Lead the way - staying up to date with tools, trends, technologies and frameworks both industry-wide and within Amazon and then sharing that knowledge in a meaningful way with the community.
  
    BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
   Degree in Computer Science or related field.
   
  
    PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
   Foundational knowledge of building large scale service and web applications in AWS or other cloud-based environments.
    Knowledge of Spring, SOA and automated testing.
    Full-stack development experience (Java, NoSQL, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, node.js) - if you've built something in your spare time send us the link, we'd love to hear about it.
    Ability to think creatively and adapt messages to the audience.
    Experience with React, HTTP/2, PWA, Serverless, Microservices, CI/CD, and cross-platform development.
    Prior use of AWS technologies at scale in a production.
    Experience with documentation, unit testing, code reviews, test automation, continuous integration & deployment and a preference for agile methods environment.
    Problem solving skills; adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership.
    ABOUT AUDIBLE

   Preferred qualifications:
   MBA or Master's degree with a quantitative focus (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, Management Information Systems, Statistics, Accounting) or other relevant field

   Ability to collaborate with internal stakeholders across different functions and geographies to manage change and drive continuous improvement initiatives 
   Excellent communication skills and executive presence to influence Google colleagues and manage business priorities 
  
   About the job
    The Google Cloud team helps companies, schools, and government seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. You listen to the customer and swiftly problem-solve technical issues to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative, and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Cloud business and helping companies around the world innovate. 
   As a Data Scientist on the Google Cloud Support team, you’ll play a key role in using data and machine intelligence to empower data-driven execution of strategy and operations for Google customers. We work collaboratively with Sales, Engineering, and other Cloud Customer Experience teams to build analytics solutions that enable actionable insights to provide an effortless customer experience. In this role, you’ll work on a variety of stakeholder projects with opportunities to address problems that require innovative solutions and data products.
    Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
  
  
    Responsibilities
   Manage the customer’s problem through effective diagnosis, resolution, or implementation of investigation tools to increase productivity for customer issues on Google Cloud Platform products. 
    Develop an in-depth understanding of Google's product technology and underlying architectures by troubleshooting, reproducing, determining the root cause for customer reported issues, and building tools for faster diagnosis. 
    Act as a consultant and subject matter expert for internal stakeholders in Engineering, Sales, and Customer organizations to resolve technical deployment obstacles and improve Google Cloud. 
    Work as part of a team of Engineers/Consultants that globally ensure 24-hour customer support. Work non-standard work hours or shifts as needed. 
    Understand customer issues and advocate for their needs with cross-functional teams, like product and engineering, to find ways to improve the product and drive high-quality production. 
   Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

The ideal candidate is a skilled web developer with extensive experience working on teams. Clear communication is key, including knowing when to ask questions. The candidate should be up to date on trends in web development and be able to research technologies independently as needed. In addition, we are looking for a candidate with experience with WordPress and coding for a high-traffic website.
 The Position:
 As web developer, you will work to develop, test, deploy, and maintain the technologies that power MotherJones.com and related infrastructure. This job includes working on the front-end design of the website, the editorial user interface used to publish content, and integrations between the website and various other systems, such as web analytics, social media, email service providers, and beyond. You will have the option of working from any of our three offices (San Francisco, New York, or Washington, DC) or working remotely.
 Requirements:
 Experience developing for WordPress
  Solid knowledge of PHP
  Solid knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  Experience working as part of a team on web development projects
 Nice to Haves:
 Experience with news/publishing organizations
  Familiarity with user experience design
  Experience with A/B testing
 The Team:
 You will be joining a small, distributed team of developers working from various locations across the country. We prefer open-source and collaborative solutions to problems. We have brief daily meetings and work in short, iterative sprints. We also take work-life balance seriously, managing the workload so that extra hours are generally not required.
 Over the last two decades, digital technologies have dramatically changed the news business. Mother Jones has successfully navigated those changes to build a powerful and successful news organization. In this position, you will help us as we continue to adapt, experiment, and iterate on our mission to produce stories that matter to the world.
 What we have to offer you is a competitive salary, great benefits, ownership of your role, the opportunity for training and growth, and a great team.
 SALARY
 Minimum $110,000, or DOE.
 HOW TO APPLY
 Only applications submitted to our website or job links will be considered for this recruiting round. Unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants for any given role, there may be delays in responding to every application submitted.
 What you’ll need for the application form:
 An updated resume;
  A well-thought-out cover letter outlining why you are right for this job; how your specific vision for this role can advance Mother Jones’ goals; and how your skills can achieve that vision.

The Consultant, Search Engine Optimization (SEO) will lead best in class strategies and flawlessly manage, execute, and optimize Organic Search campaigns from conception through to the analytics and optimizations. This role will be responsible for managing specific client accounts inside of the agency’s Organic Search organization. This role will be responsible for managing specific client accounts inside of the agency’s Organic Search organization.

This role will work with internal cross-departmental teams to evolve the Agency’s execution of Organic Search, ensuring the collective success of the agency and our customers. Recommend strategies and insights across all Organic Search accounts.

Overview

Rise Interactive (http://www.riseinteractive.com), a rapidly growing full service interactive advertising agency, is looking to hire a Senior Internet Marketing Consultant, SEO for our Search team. Excellent presentation and verbal communication skills

Position Overview
 This is a senior-level marketing consultant position, providing research and analysis, marketing plan development, strategic direction, project management and facilitation for Blue Door Consulting’s clients. In this role, you will be expected to execute upon those recommendations, through tactics such as brand development, creative direction, copywriting, SEM/SEO and developing websites (excluding programming/coding). In this role, you will communicate and represent Blue Door Consulting to regional and national audiences in order to position Blue Door Consulting as a thought leader.
 Primary Responsibilities
 In order to help our clients grow, you will meet regularly with clients to discuss project requirements, identify growth opportunities, and develop and implement project plans. You are well-suited for this position if you thrive on problem solving, enjoy project management and are driven to get results. Among your day-to-day activities:
 Meeting with clients and identifying solutions that help their businesses grow
  Researching, analyzing and synthesizing data for recommendations and proposals
  Developing strategy for brands and/or campaigns
  Providing creative direction for brand identity, content, collateral and more
  Providing public/media relations: pitch stories, create newsworthy events and build media relationships to secure coverage for Blue Door Consulting clients
  Writing copy and editing a wide range of materials, including but not limited to proposals, recommendations, creative briefs, websites, e-newsletters and research documentation
  Developing and executing upon digital solutions such as website development, social media, search engine optimization, search engine marketing, keyword analysis and analytics
 Work Environment ExpectationsBlue Door Consulting is a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment, powered by high levels of trust, vulnerability and accountability. You are best positioned to succeed in this environment with the: * Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively as a team player and with grace and flexibility in a rapidly changing environment
 Appreciation that two days will never be the same
  Ability to work under pressure and with tight deadlines
  Desire to stay current in both pop culture and business/marketing trends
  Conscientiousness when handling sensitive information effectively and confidentially
 Skill Sets and QualificationsWe value team members who are unafraid of learning and growth, who possess the ability to discern insights and make recommendations and are effective communicators. To demonstrate these characteristics, we look for:
 Bachelors in either Communications, Journalism, Business, Marketing or similar
  A minimum of 5 years’ experience in marketing
  Demonstrated ability to understand, use and learn changing technologies, with knowledge of website development, social media platforms, email marketing, content marketing, SEO/SEM, etc.
  Certified in Google Analytics and AdWords (professional certification must occur within three months of being hired if not currently certified)
  Outstanding interpersonal skills; must have credibility, good judgment, honesty and integrity
  Effective skills in time management, budgeting and program oversight
  Ability to generate and deliver persuasive and clear verbal and written communications
  Initiative to solve problems with energy and a positive attitude
 About Blue Door Consulting
 Blue Door Consulting is a successful marketing consulting firm located in Oshkosh, Wisconsin. Started in 2002, Blue Door Consulting has a unique culture that supports and mentors its talented and growing team with its focus on professional development and constant learning. Blue Door Consulting was winner of the Oshkosh Chamber of Commerce’s “Small Business of the Year” in 2011and the Fox Cities Chamber of Commerce Business Innovation Award in 2018Dedicated to its varied clients from small start-ups to Fortune 500’s, the team of Blue Door Consulting is inspired and motivated to go above and beyond, providing excellent customer service, objective consulting and ethical recommendations.
 Located in a renovated granary, Blue Door Consulting’s offices provide a creative workspace with lots of extra team-building perks, including office lunches, stocked employee refrigerators and after-hour get-togethers, along with two cozy fireplaces and seating areas. Our team members want to be challenged, are knowledgeable about changing technologies and online innovations, enjoy critical thinking and are willing to push themselves and our clients.

   Our mission is to live our “at your side” promise and simplify and enrich the lives of our customers, employees, and communities.    The Manager, Paid Search & SEO oversees all planning and execution for paid search and SEO initiatives. This position creates plans to drive ad effectiveness, customer value, and business results, with the ability to quickly iterate and evolve those plans to meet changing business needs. This role manages multiple initiatives simultaneously and ensures best-in-class paid search and organic search optimization, delivery, and performance results. 
   This role is skilled at working with diverse, cross-functional stakeholder groups and managing 3rd party vendors, as well as translating SEM and SEO in positive, quantifiable business outcomes. Additionally, this position analyzes data and leverages their expertise to drive continuous improvement and provide specialized expertise and guidance to business stakeholders and staff.
  
   Duties and Responsibilities
   Paid Search (SEM)
   Manage all planning and execution for paid search campaigns across business divisions and units
    Create thoughtful, data-driven pay-per-click (PPC) plans that support key performance indicators (KPIs) and business objectives with various strategies and tactics
    Drive paid search innovation via continuous optimization and new offerings such as Google Shopping
    Accountable for paid search budget management and forecasting
    Manage and oversee reporting and read-outs to the business
    Drive continuous improvements and exercise judgement to meet business needs
  
   Organic Search (SEO)
   Manage SEO initiatives across business divisions and units
    Create thoughtful, data-driven SEO plans that support key performance indicators (KPIs) and business objectives with various strategies and tactics
    Drive organic search innovation via continuous optimization and new offerings such as Schema, alt tags, and content
    Manage and oversee reporting and read-outs to the business
    Continually improve website SEO with an eye toward “raising the bar” on keyword rank and authority
    Manage communication with both internal stakeholders and vendors to ensure optimal SEO understanding and project delivery
  
   Requirements
  
   Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
    A minimum 7 years' experience managing search initiatives for mid-to-large organizations and/or agencies
    Google Adwords Certification required
    Google Shopping and Google Analytics Certifications preferred
  
   Software/Technical Skills
   Knowledge of paid and organic search KPIs required
    Proficiency with Google Adwords required
    Excellent command of Microsoft Office (especially Excel and PowerPoint) required
    Working knowledge of enterprise SEO platforms (Conductor, Brightedge) preferred
    Working knowledge of Tag Management Platforms (Tealium, GTM) preferred
  
   Brother Offers
   A competitive base salary
    Rich and comprehensive benefits package
    Casual dress environment
    Tuition reimbursement: Up to 10k yearly
    Access to learning and development online and in-person classes

 Grow with Us
 – A World of Opportunity Awaits
 As our SEO Account Manager, you’ll have the opportunity to work with the best in the industry and with leaders who genuinely support and challenge our employees to reach their full potential.
 As an SEO Account Manager, you must be quick on your toes and be able to think two steps ahead of the algorithm. You’re the face of Rankings for our clients and an optimization artist who will oversee and strategize all SEO for your accounts.
 This role is perfect for a natural problem-solver who can build and maintain strong relationships while understanding the nuances of SEO.
 __________________________________________________________________________
 What makes a successful SEO agency?
 Growth, empowerment, freedom, and personal achievement…
 Notice how we didn’t mention SEO?
 Yes, the actual craft of SEO is essential, and we pride ourselves on being leaders of the industry, but at Rankings, we hold those first four principles in the highest regard.
 We believe that our people are mission-critical to success, so we always ensure that you’re taken care of first.
 We challenge each other to be bold, push boundaries and explore new frontiers.
 These primary drivers allow us to innovate at the forefront of our field and provide the best environment for our team, the best content for our clients, and ultimately, the best results for the people our clients protect.
 You’re not just ‘getting a job’ when you work with us.
 Instead, you’re embarking on a journey of self-discovery that will sharpen your skills and put your career into hyper-drive.
 Who We Are
 Rankings is the only digital marketing agency that’s solely focused on SEO for elite personal
 injury law firms across the country. Our entire team is dedicated to helping our clients dominate search results in the most competitive niche using our unparalleled industry expertise.
 Who You Are
 Passionate - You’re deeply curious about how the world works and have an insatiable interest in SEO. Your intense desire to learn is infectious and inspires others around you to do the same.
 Creative - You brainstorm competitive ways to differentiate our work from the rest of the pack. You’re a dynamic problem solver who’s always on the lookout for new opportunities in the field.
 Goal-oriented - You are aggressive with your strategy, and once you’ve locked on a target, you meticulously plan a course of action and apply it accordingly.
 Innovative - You see things differently, and you’re comfortable trying things that have never been done before. You’re not afraid of taking on impossible odds, even if it means taking risks.
 Hungry - You know what you want, and you're willing to go out and get it. You're highly motivated and determined to better yourself, your work, and the results you achieve.
 “It’s not all science; there’s also an art to what we do.”
 __________________________________________________________________________
 The Deets
 $100k (Starting at $60k); pay commensurate with experience
  Working remote (work from home)
  14 days PTO, first year
  3% Match SIMPLE IRA
  Health Insurance (including fully employer-funded coverage available)
  Job Type: Full-time
 As an Account Manager, you need to articulate that you’re trustworthy to clients. You’re going to be there for them. Understand what they want, and you will fulfill those needs.
 Are you?
 A superb communicator who can translate client needs into actionable strategies that an internal team will undertake?
  Well organized and can take care of clients’ requests proactively and efficiently?
  Proactive about noticing problems and can provide solutions before others see them?
  A master of communication, so the team knows what to expect and where they are headed?
  A master at blending the right and left brain?
  Look at numbers and analytics, develop a story of those numbers, and articulate them back to clients or other interested parties?
 Can You?
 Get the clients the things they need on time and make sure they are informed?
  Savor victories with the client?
  Build value and clear, realistic expectations?
  Can you communicate the value of our organization effectively to a client and embody that value in all that you do?
  Use trust and understanding to solicit more in-depth conversations and ultimately more value that impacts our strategy, which is geared towards clients' goals.
  Stand your ground. Sometimes a client may ask for unrealistic things, and there’s a correct way to do this.
 Here’s what you’ll be up to
 Act as a liaison between clients and the internal operations team.
  Share new services and recommendations back to clients in their best interest.
  Lead the client (interesting fact: “strategy” is from the Latin “strategia,” which means “art of leadership”).
  Maintaining and protecting company margins (i.e., alerting clients when their requests are out-of-scope).
  Growth of accounts (making clients aware of other services and actions that may lead to greater success).
  Read social signals and pre-empt any challenges.
  Manage account reviews, mistakes, etc.
  Keep abreast of trends, changes, and competitor actions that might affect our clients.
  Create progress reports, perform consultations, and always ensure that clients know what we are doing and the value they are receiving.
 We’d like for you to have the following please
 Solid experience and a good understanding of SEO (search engine optimization) and digital marketing.
  Experience in account management or a similar role or avenue.
  Familiarity with industry-standard SEO tools, including (but not limited to) Screaming Frog, Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Ahrefs, & SEMrush.
  Empathy, EQ, and soft skills (i.e., strong customer service and interpersonal skills).
  Excellent verbal and written communication skills (to communicate product ideas to clients).
  Analytical skills for analyzing client data.
  Time management and multitasking skills (to handle multiple tasks and clients, often at once, and working in an autonomous environment).
  Good boundaries with strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

**We’re local to the Houston area – no agencies or contractors, please! All applicants must already live in Houston; we will not provide relocation assistance.**
 Who Are We?
 We’re a growing company in the telecommunications and insurance industry, located in NW Houston. We’ve been in business for almost 26 years, and achieve success through all sorts of different media opportunities. We run multiple web properties in a direct response world. It’s not traditional e-commerce – we use our sites to drive phone calls and form leads – but our sites are built and constantly optimized to convert clicks into leads. We’re looking for a dynamic SEO specialist to drive more traffic and more clicks.
 Our office is located on a 75,000 sf campus in NW Houston with a serious team of marketers, account managers, customer service reps, and salespeople- the real deal. We believe in fostering a workplace where we work hard, have fun, learn new things, and enjoy a positive work/life balance.
 What Would You Do In This Role?
 As the SEO Manager, you would play a critical role in continuing to expand TGS Insurance Agency, which is doubling in size annually.
 We have big aspirations and are looking for a data-driven senior SEO marketer with a track record of delivering on goals to take us to the next level. You’ll have the tools you need at your disposal and will be working alongside an established team consisting of an SEO Director, writers, developers, and other media tacticians.
 Do you see the opportunity in front of us? Are you ready to get started?
 Responsibilities:
 Work cross-functionally with internal teams to manage end-to-end campaign execution, ensuring strategies are aligned, assets are created, and deadlines are met.
  Stay abreast of industry trends and continually identify and present new SEO opportunities.
  Managing optimization of all content (video, imagery, articles)
  Conduct SEO technical audits, make recommendations based on findings and guide the implementation of those recommendations to ensure best practices are maintained.
  Develop and implement white-hat link building strategy
 Qualifications:
 5+ years of experience developing and implementing SEO strategies
  Demonstrated organic experience that has directly driven top Google SERP positioning
  Proven ability to tie together off-page SEO and technical SEO to the core content strategy
  Ability to strategically set goals and priorities and align a team behind achieving those outcomes
  A test and learn mentality. You may not have the knowledge today to crack every aspect of the Google algorithm, but your curiosity to actively test and learn will decipher the evolving nature of how to rank #1.
  Critical thinking skills and a creative mindset to help develop effective engagement tactics
  Proficient in SEO-related tools/platforms, including Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google My Business, Semrush, Moz, and Screaming Frog.
  Strong, data-centric analytical skills
  Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel and/or Google Docs
  Knowledge of WordPress SEO
  Working knowledge of HTML and/or CSS is a plus!
 Benefits:
 Health, dental, vision, life, and voluntary insurance programs with company contribution
  401(k) with generous company match (up to 5%)
  Paid vacation time plus holidays off throughout the year
  Great work/life balance!
  Remote capability (We prefer our team in-office, but believe in flexibility to WFH when needed!)
 GrowthIt's an exciting time to be a part of The TGS Insurance Agency team. Our company is growing fast and we want you to be a part of its success! If you’ve got your eyes on career growth and leadership roles, then this is the place to be. We promote from within and almost all of our leadership and the executive team started in an entry-level role. We’ve got big things planned for the future! Come join us and be a part of the next big thing!

SEO ManagerTempe, AZ or Remote
 Select Blind's vision is to empower people to create spaces they can be proud of. We want to provide an exceptional customer experience that builds confidence with the most diverse selection of window coverings and helpful resources through the entire customer lifecycle. We are growing quickly and are looking for passionate people who want to join a team where they feel valued and where they can actively contribute to growing and building something meaningful. Our company DNA is founded in empowerment and compassion but also fun. We like to laugh. It’s just who we are.
 Position Description
 The SEO Manager will be responsible for accelerating our organic search presence through developing new technical and front facing content. They will be key in supplementing our business by working with our creative and IT team to help communicate our products unique uses and features. Blinds don’t just cover up a window, they block light, create atmosphere, and provide value. It’ll be up to you to communicate this not only to curious customers, but Google, Yahoo, Bing, and other emerging platforms. The SEO Manager will need to build a coalition across nearly every department of our company to help gather and organize data that’s relevant to our users.
 Position Responsibilities
 Manage technical content behind the scenes, while assisting in the development of fresh customer facing content.
  Create meaningful relationships to develop a rich backlinking programs.
  Seek out, diagnose, and fix SEO issues using Google Merchant Center and Google Analytics.
  Be the leader that helps the business improve our Core Web Vitals strategically.
  Stay up to date on the latest trends and updates across every search platform.
  Analyze weak points and keyword gaps, then work with other marketers to help close those gaps and drive sessions.
  Develop regular progress reports which shows activity through the entirety of the sales funnel.
 Ideal Skills & Experience
 Applied experience with leading national brands.
  Strong project management skills.
  Analytical, curious, and motivated; an ability to discover problems before they become big.
  Collaborative style, experience working with creative designers.
  Enthusiastic about organic search, and emerging trends.
  Highly organized, with attention to detail.
  Always testing, always curious.
  Experience in Home Improvement or technical retail preferred
  3 – 4 years of experience managing search programs with at least $1 million budgets.
  Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Finance, Business, or related field.
  Strong portfolio of successful campaigns across several search platforms.
  Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics, SEM Rush, and SEO Moz.
  Ability to use a PC.
  Able to work remotely or in-office as work requires.
  Strong written and verbal skills.
  Strong analytical skills.
 About Us: 
 SelectBlinds.com is a leader in DIY custom blinds, where our goal is to provide a friendly, relaxed online environment as an alternative to the aggressive showroom buying environments our competitors create. Our customers are homeowners who want high-quality, budget friendly DIY window coverings that are as unique as they are. International brands, big showrooms, and large contracting firms all said making the process of ordering custom blinds online could never be simple or intuitive, but SelectBlinds.com is in the business of engineering solutions. We have over 500,000 5-star reviews proving the naysayers wrong!

About Ancestry:
   When you join Ancestry, you join a human-centered company where every person’s story is important. We believe that by discovering the struggles and triumphs of our past, we can foster deeper bonds and more meaningful connections among families and communities. Our talented team of scientists, engineers, genealogists, historians, and storytellers is dedicated to empowering customers around the world from all backgrounds on their journeys of personal discovery.
   With more than 30+ billion digitized global historical records, 100+ million family trees, and 20+ million people in our growing AncestryDNA database, Ancestry helps customers discover their family story and gain a new level of understanding about their lives. Passionate about dedicating your work to enriching people’s lives? You belong at Ancestry.
   The Sr. Marketing Manager, SEO role is responsible for bringing new customers to Ancestry through natural search. You will be responsible for driving SEO traffic across our global portfolio of websites, under the guidance of the SEO Director. We are looking for well-rounded experience in both technical SEO and content marketing, plus the ability to communicate SEO needs to internal and external partners.
   What You'll Do:
  Help drive the SEO content strategy through keyword research and data-driven testing 
   Draw insights from multiple data sources and communicate those findings with partners 
   Drive product initiatives that increase SEO growth at scale by translating business objectives into technical requirements 
   Identify new SEO industry trends that could impact Ancestry websites and communicate those trends to the relevant partners 
   Increase Ancestry’s international footprint through localized approaches to SEO in a growing number of countries 
   Help coordinate reporting and auditing that is leveraged for prioritizing SEO improvements 
  Who You Are:
  5+ years of enterprise SEO experience for medium to large websites 
   Experience with all aspects of SEO including content marketing, technical SEO and off-page optimization 
   Familiar with a variety of web technologies including enterprise CMS tools, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, page rendering solutions and Core Web Vitals 
   Experience with common SEO analytics and tools including Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, seoClarity, Conductor, BrightEdge, Searchmetrics, Google Data Studio, and Similarweb 
   Comfortable working on large websites with millions of pages that require scalable approaches to SEO performance

In addition, Ancestry will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

The Microsoft Global Demand Center (GDC) within the Cloud Marketing Group is leading the marketing transformation of Microsoft’s largest and fastest growing commercial businesses. Our websites are the public face of Microsoft, where individuals, communities, and businesses can directly experience all that’s possible with our products. The SEO manager will develop and execute strategies to drive traffic and revenue for key cloud products. You have at least 4+ years of hands-on SEO experience (technical and content), including solving tough enterprise-level SEO problems with global footprints, developing sound strategies to support early funnel traffic, and educating and influencing a broad set of stakeholders in an enterprise environment. The senior SEO Manager works closely with engineering and marketing web teams, product marketing, engineering, paid/SEM teams, content strategists and studio writers, and agency partners to evolve and sustain a holistic, scalable, impactful SEO program that maximizes SEO benefit against business objectives and priorities. Our team: The Content and SEO team in the Lifecycle Program organization is a fast-paced group with global stakeholders. We put a focus on getting things done, simplifying anything and everything, and having fun while doing it. We all believe that content matters—from strategy to execution—and that it is at the cornerstone of helping our customers find us, and they inspire them to take action when they do find us. You will be in the middle of it all helping to make decisions that impact our resources, timelines, and global web experiences. 
  
  Responsibilities
  
    Important things that you’ll help drive: An SEO strategy that maximizes traffic and revenue opportunities Analysis of complex data sets to identify opportunities, forecast results, and implement strategies in a cross-functional team Collaboration with business groups to solve technical problems, provide optimization recommendations, and forecast impact to initiate traffic across our web properties Actionable insights that help partner teams improve efficiency of paid online marketing spend and site operations What you’ll do: Focus on on-page SEO strategies and tactics, informing content strategies that are critical to customer journeys Perform forensic technical SEO audits and inspections of websites to identify on-page, off-page, and technical issues Monitor global sites regularly for technical crawl issues and other relevant errors monthly and provide solution-based recommendations Identify growth opportunities in site infrastructure, keyword selection, and on-page optimization Monitor performance metrics to understand organic search performance and measure the impact of technical and content changes Analyze large amounts of data from a variety of sources and prepare executive-ready reports and insights of SEO campaign performance Stay current on global SEO and search landscape and emerging trends and identify tools and reports to automate processes or deliver more sophisticated analysis Who you are: Obsessed with SEO. You know the landscape of industry tools to audit, research, and analyze search data, and how to derive meaningful insights from what you uncover. Equally comfortable with both technical and content optimization; in this role, the strong focus is on content, but you’ll do both. Passionate to help others learn. You recognize your own SEO expertise, but also know that with great power comes great responsibility—and seek out opportunities to educate other marketers and engineers. A believer in data democratization and you understand that openly sharing SEO data only helps make the SEO program stronger. Fact-based, data-driven. You persuade with facts, not fluff. And you always challenge your own assumptions. 
  
  Qualifications
  
    Bachelor’s degree required 5+ years’ practical experience in global SEO environment Deep familiarity Adobe Analytics/Omniture and other analytics and reporting tools, including Power BI Highly proficient in Excel with the ability to analyze data and prepare report presentations Ability to draw conclusions from data to create business cases, market insights, and requirements for SEO Experience using SEO tools including but not limited to SEMRush, BrightEdge, Google Search Console, Bing WMT, Deepcrawl, Screaming Frog, and others Ability to manage multiple projects in highly-matrixed organizations, often with competing priorities A demonstrated track record of increasing rankings, traffic, and revenue while managing and executing SEO strategies and tactics Well-versed in online marketing best practices and measurement Understanding of site management, web development principles.

We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. The Associate SEO Specialist is an individual contributor member of the Dealer Inspire SEO Department, who is responsible for assisting in the completion of client task work. Associates work under the supervision of an SEO to complete required client work, and in turn, learn the skills and critical thinking required to become a Specialist. Dealer Inspire Associate SEO Specialists work with SEOs (including Seniors), Copywriters and Performance Managers to help deliver industry leading results and organic growth, making strong organization, time management and communications skills a critical part of success in this role.

Associate SEO Specialists must complete, with accuracy and attention to detail, a heavy load of client tasks each month, as assigned. After demonstrating task proficiency, Associate Specialists may be fully assigned a limited number of accounts. While SEO experience isn't required for this role as training is provided, critical thinking, time management, and being calm under pressure are traits that lead to success.

The SEO Department focuses on developing industry experts who love their careers, and having a team of passionate people who support each other is key - want to learn a bit more about our department and why we're a great team to be a part of? Check us out!

Duties:

Apply critical thinking to provided SEO education in order to learn concepts and tasks

Engage in department goal efforts

Communicate proactively and clearly about blockers

Regularly keep up with SEO news and digital marketing trends

Active interest in organic search, search engines and digital marketing, and drive to stay abreast of industry news and updates

"Always learning" attitude, driven by the desire to continuously gain knowledge and improve skills

Ability to comfortably and successfully complete assigned tasks within outlined time requirements and by required due dates each month

Ability to accurately manage a partial load of assigned clients

Willingness to work overtime as needed to complete client work on schedule

Critical thinking and reasoning skills; the ability to take learned concepts and apply them appropriately to unique situations in order to arrive at the most logical plan of action

Adaptability; willingness to accept and embrace changing processes, gray areas, and new ideas with ease and enthusiasm

Scored at a 1 or 2 in all areas of the SEO skills matrix

Strong written and verbal communication and grammar

Adherence to company tenets and department identity statement

Must be detail-oriented with exceptional proofreading skills

Ability to think creatively to solve problems

Ability to work independently and collaborate within a team

Clear understanding and capable execution of SEO tasks and concepts after successful training
Consistently meeting deadlines, within time requirements with quality work product and correct application of SEO principles

High Levels of Engagement with Team, Department and Company

Regularly demonstrating a drive to learn, improve and grow in their role
