Are you passionate about delivering highly secure, highly productive development tools to engineers? Do you see cloud-computing as the future and want to be a part of the Azure story? Do you want to drive a change and impact across Azure? Are you passionate in learning new technology?
  
  
  
    Come and join the Azure Engineering Systems team. Our mission is to enable the world’s best engineering platform with built-in security and compliance standards to help engineers in Azure to ship products their customers love.
  
  
  
    Our vision is to enable developers to build and deploy code with security and compliance built seamlessly into developer workflow – and all of that at the scale of Azure and beyond. We are looking for a product manager who not only understands the technical nuances of a secure and compliant DevOps pipelines, but is able to work with customers and learn their needs across the breadth of the CI area. As part of the role, you will be collaborating with Core Azure Teams driving a change in the way Engineers manage their devops pipelines.
  
  
  
    This is a remote friendly position within the US.
  
   Responsibilities
  
    This Role is focused on working with our customers and our engineers to build a best in class engineering system integrating containers into our dev-ops flow. You will be working with large organization across Microsoft with an opportunity to influence beyond your own organization chain. Own and drive strategy, feature planning and prioritization, competitive market analysis, collaborating with open-source community, coming-up with quantifiable impact, identifying risks and investments areas are some of the key areas you will be driving to move the needle.
  
  
  
    We believe that team diversity is key to our success. To that end, you’ll help create a work environment that’s inclusive to all perspectives, incentivizes diversity and creates accountability for positive team collaboration.
  
   Qualifications
  
    Required Qualifications:
  
  
   3+ years of Product/Program Management or Software Development and related experience.
    3+ years of building cloud services and/or Cloud Dev Ops solutions.
   
   Preferred Qualifications:
  
  
   Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
    Experience in Azure Dev Ops or other popular DevOps technologies is preferred.
    Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical people.
    Excellent oral and written communication skills.
    Demonstrated cross team collaboration and project execution capabilities.
    Thrive in a fast-paced work environment.
  
    #AEPJobs #EPSSJOBS
  
  
  
    Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: 
   Microsoft Cloud Background Check: 
   This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
  
  
  
    Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
  
  
  
    Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Engineering
Security
We are looking for a passionate Product Manager to join Spotify’s Security department. Our mission is to enable Spotify to build and maintain safe products at speed and scale. The Security department sets the strategy and direction for all of Spotify’s cyber security capabilities. This includes; detection & response, vulnerability management, cloud security, IT security, compliance engineering, risk management and more.
Location
New York or Remote Americas
Job type
Permanent
As a Product Manager in this space, you will ensure our vision and roadmaps are in line with business objectives. You will work alongside other Product Managers, Engineering Managers, Data Scientists and Designers. You will interact with people across our entire company: other engineering teams, as well as employees in HR, Legal, Finance, Public Relations and more. It is a great opportunity to help us further mature the overall security posture, and to deliver impactful and scalable security initiatives across the company.
What You'll Do
Be on top of new product and technology trends to advance our security capabilities, while balancing an excellent user experience
Define and drive product vision, strategy and metrics, galvanizing teams to follow you
Balance needs around usability, productivity, security and scale to create optimal experiences for employees across 40+ countries
Work with the Engineering Manager to ensure healthy delivery – including technical capabilities, happiness, resilience, and growth, as well as determining what we buy, what we build, and where we collaborate with technology providers to advance the state of tech
Ensure your team is doing the right things, while not being spread too thinly. A healthy balance of innovation, support and maintenance is key for successful teams at Spotify
Who You Are
You have a strong technical background and wide knowledge of cyber security offerings
You are passionate about balancing security with exceptional user experience
You are experienced in defining and driving product strategy
You are experienced with data driven product development
You are an interdisciplinary thinker, skilled at blending different perspectives in pursuit of a mission
You have excellent leadership and relationship building skills
You are a great communicator and inspiring storyteller
You are good at sorting out ambiguity
You are structured and give close attention to details
Where You'll Be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location and is within working hours.
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration and ask that all be located in that time zone.
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here.
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users and our creators. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of changing the way the world listens to music.
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users.
Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure
Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.
This role is not eligible for hire in Colorado, USA.

About Us:

Blockgraph is a technology company that makes the future of data-driven TV advertising possible.

The world's leading media, technology, and information services companies collaborate with trusted partners using Blockgraph's Identity Operating System (IDoS) to create and implement privacy-focused targeting and measurement solutions.

Our company maintains a rigorous commitment to creating a better advertising and identity ecosystem necessary for shepherding in the next golden era of TV. Blockgraph is owned by: Charter Communications Inc., Comcast NBCUniversal, and Paramount (formerly ViacomCBS Inc.)
About the Role:

In this role you will work on the platform and applications. You will work on the business direction, technical approaches and user experience of the product. You will work on synthesizing business use cases and product requirements. You will coordinate across partners, internal teams including engineering and DevOps on ideation, design and enhancements to the platform.

You will work in conjunction with the product leadership team to manage product releases. You will work closely with the rest of the team on timeline planning and execution, and on designing and launching future products and applications.

For your role you need to quickly learn the key elements of advertising, TV, online video and cable businesses.

Job Responsibilities
Taking product/business ideas and turning them into solutions
Contribute towards product workflow design
Provide detailed product/tech requirements to engineers
Managing / tracking new feature requests and feature improvements from clients
Product release testing and user acceptance testing
Product user guide
Manage product development life cycle
Requirements for the position:
Education:
Either: Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree in Computer Science or another STEM degree (e.g. Math/Physics/Electrical Engineering etc.)
Or: An MBA
Understanding of a full product lifecycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization and pre/post-launch execution
Be able to work across teams, manage expectations and execute on clear timelines.
Highly organized, diligent, exceptional problem-solving and time management skills
Exception interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
Personable with strong relationship and partnership building skills
Optional/nice to have's:
Experience or interest in cloud technologies or distributed systems e.g. AWS
Our Employees are Guided By Our Company's Values:
Customer Mindset: Our customers and the privacy of our customer's data are at the center of everything we do.
Innovators: We don't accept the status quo.
Seek to Compete: We compete hard for our customers' business. And we always do it with integrity.
Ownership Mentality: We take personal accountability for serving our clients and providing them the best possible solutions.
Win Together: We believe that we can go farther together.
Why work for Blockgraph?
Blockgraph offers employees the best of both worlds – the excitement, speed and flexibility of working in a startup paired with the financial backing and support of some of the world's largest media, entertainment and technology companies.

Come work with great people, solve interesting problems, and create meaningful positive impact for an industry.

In addition to these benefits we offer competitive salary and benefits, a flexible work environment, and access to professional development opportunities.

Blockgraph recruits, employs, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, disability, age, veteran status and other protected status as required by applicable law and as a matter of our company ethics.

Description 
   The Platform Services Database Product Line is responsible for defining, developing, engineering and operating Database products consumed by our Application Development Partners across the firm. Our Product Portfolio includes Private and Public Cloud offerings 
   As a Product Manager you will work as part of the Opensource Relational Database (ORD) team in Platform Services, enabling key features in line with JP Morgan's control policies. 
  Key Responsibilities of the Role  As a Product Manager, you play an important role in the design and development of our modern public and private cloud ORD offerings. You will bring your past experience to a talented group to further evolve the technical capabilities of our organization, drive improvements across our SDLC and unlock new capabilities for our clients. All roles in Platform Services are expected to continuously collaborate across all cloud product offerings. 
  We look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering. You'll be required to apply your Product expertise to all aspects of Product Management, from customer and stakeholder engagement, to prioritization of the Engineering team's backlog, with collaboration across other Database and infrastructure teams. You will own your Product's Profit & Loss, budgeting and financial forecasting. You will lead and inspire engineers to work toward a common goal, with our customers at the heart of your strategic decisions. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. 
  Attributes of Technologists in Platform Services Database Products
  
    Respect for people and opinions and the ability to confidently offer your point of view 
     A drive to proactively build trust in order to cultivate long lasting productive relationships 
     Optimism and adaptability when faced with challenges and complex situations, coupled with the drive to solve complex problems and continuously optimize processes 
     Take ownership of development of your skillset and talents. E mbrace the opportunities change brings 
     Take pride in the team's vision and goals, and commit to the achievement of your line and job family performance objectives, plus delivery standards that ensure exceptional service 
     Recognize your responsibility to all of your customers and willingly take personal ownership of service issues 
     Understand company values, and IT's Operational Plan/ priorities; keep abreast of changes and progress 
     Demonstrate initiative, be positive and proactive; make suggestions for improving ways of working and enhancing your customers' experience 
    
  The role will require proficiency in all aspects of Product and Engineering Management, responsibilities include:
  
    Reviewing and elaborating stakeholder requirements. Working with customers to own and shape the product direction, balancing what's technically feasible and what is desired by the end user 
     Collaborating with teams across the firm to further the Global Technology strategy of providing first class services for our customers 
     Maintaining the highest standard of Risk, Controls and Audit requirements 
     Leading an engineering team to implement solutions with an equal focus on both functional and non-functional requirements 
     Understand/apply reusable code design, leverage application architecture/framework capabilities and functionality, and design/develop solutions that are highly reliable, scalable, and perform to meet business-defined service levels. . 
     Employ Agile practices; Continuous Improvement, Pair Programming, Continuous Integration, Test Driven Development, etc. 
    
  Technical Skills:
  
    Experience in Software and / or Infrastructure Engineering 
     Experience defining and prioritizing engineering requirements with Acceptance Criteria, preferably in Jira 
     Experience working with large scale, cloud infrastructure systems 
     Expertise in leveraging APIs, and security, authentication and data structures 
     Expertise in Agile practices to facilitate rapid delivery with short feedback loops 
     Experience implementing software engineering best practices; automated testing, CI/CD, TDD.. 
     Experience with Relational Databases 
     Experience using customer engagement tools such as Journey Mapping and Personas is advantageous 
     Experience working with public cloud (AWS, Google or Azure), is advantageous. 
     Experience in application and system configuration management of a large fleet (1000's of nodes under management), is advantageous. 
    
  What's in it for you?  Besides having pride in delivering value to our largest footprint database and delighting our customers, you will be part of a great team, helping our customers unlock the potential of a 'No DBA' model. As a team we care about each other and how we too can embrace modernization. We focus on:
  
    Continued career advancement opportunities, including industry recognized certifications, such as AWS and CKAD 
     Exposure to strong mentorship and leadership examples 
     Professional and technical development programs 
     Opportunities to be a valuable member of a close-knit, collaborative, diverse team that encourages networking 
    
  JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management. 
  We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs. 
  The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.
   As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.
   Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

Product
Developer Tools & Infrastructure
The Platform team creates the technology that enables Spotify to learn quickly and scale easily, enabling rapid growth in our users and our business around the globe. Spanning many disciplines, we work to make the business work; creating the frameworks, capabilities and tools needed to welcome a billion customers. Join us and help to amplify productivity, quality and innovation across Spotify.
Location
New York or Remote Americas
Job type
Permanent
The Core Infrastructure team is building the next generation of cloud native service platforms to accelerate developer efficiency. This is key to our mission and our work here would act as a force multiplier so that Spotify developers could see significant productivity benefits. We strive to tear down the challenges and inefficiencies of traditional cloud infrastructure tooling and products to better serve the needs of all users working with backend services. In this role, you will define, build and deliver a seamless experience for integrated compute, networking and storage. This next-generation infrastructure will offer greater capabilities and increased flexibility along with simplified deployments, fleet-wide management, and integrated support for managing cost and reliability.
Collaborating with industry leaders with vision and domain experts along with co-creating with innovative developer portals like Backstage, you will be the 'voice of the customer' and deliver on our Platform team mission to accelerate innovation and impact, safely and at scale, within and beyond Spotify.
Who you are
You have 5+ years of product management experience building creative tooling, preferably in the Developer Experience space. You have built products from the ground up, meaning that you have had to make decisions about where to start and how to proceed with a blank slate.
Experience and a solid understanding of one or more public cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and their infrastructure offerings.
Experienced in defining and driving product strategy across more than one team and growing product managers.
A highly collaborative leader that is capable of formulating and advocating for a clear, impactful product vision and strategy and working cross-functionally to deliver on that roadmap.
You are experienced with data-driven product development and have a passion for open-source software.
You are an excellent communicator and storyteller, presenting concepts and ideas in different formats, depending on the context.
Creative in all the right ways. You’re bursting with non-traditional ideas, and not afraid to give them all a try but you also know how to balance those fun ideas with reality, resources, and business needs.
What you'll do
Manage and mentor 2-4 Product Managers, working across Deployment, Service Frameworks, Configuration Management and leading large-scale migrations across a mature service fleet
Build and complete a cohesive product vision that ladders up to our mission’s strategy and Spotify’s goals for these verticals
Partner with Engineering, Design, and Insights leaders to foster a team culture of impact, performance, and happiness
Ensure your team is aligned with team and company leadership and focusing on the right things, always balancing quality vs speed and short vs long term needs
Help drive alignment and partnership between Cloud Foundations PMs and PMs on different Product Areas within Core Infrastructure
Build and maintain a positive relationship with high-level partners (Infrastructure teams, Platform teams, Security, and Backstage) across Spotify
Where you'll be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location and is within working hours.
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration and ask that all be located in that time zone.
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here.
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.
Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure
Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.

The Security Compliance and Management Customer Experience Engineering (CXE) team at Microsoft is on a mission to enable organizations to deliver the Modern Workplace that is loved by users and trusted by IT. To accomplish this mission, the Customer Acceleration Team (CAT) team within SCM engages deeply with our top strategic enterprise customers to help them architect and consume our Modern Workplace unified endpoint management solutions. CAT is looking for a customer-focused individual to work directly with these customers. This individual will understand our customers’ requirements and deliver solutions that not only satisfy their needs but exceed their expectations.
  
  
    #scimjobs
  
   Responsibilities
  
    This customer-focused individual will have three areas of responsibility:
  
   Architecture & Consumption: Collaborate with key stakeholders to identify customers’ business and technical requirements, architect consumable solutions that meet customer needs, facilitate and guide solution consumption (including Windows, iOS, Mac and Android modern management via Microsoft Endpoint Manager and Windows 10), and to otherwise act as a strategic technical consumption advisor to our customers.
    Product & Service Insights: Working with the rest of the SCM, Windows, Office Web/Mobile, and Azure Active Directory engineering teams, use your knowledge and expertise of CAT’s enterprise customers to help guide the future direction of our products and services.
    Ecosystem Enablement: Use your subject matter expertise to train and enable our scalable consumption ecosystem.
   Qualifications
  
    Successful candidates will demonstrate these skills and qualifications:
  
   Passion for enabling great customer experiences
    Experience working with enterprise customers on difficult, technical issues and developing innovative, creative solutions
    Highly self-driven with an ability to work very independently
    An ability to work well within fast-paced, ambiguous situations where you need to define the problem, goal, solution and then see execution through to the end
    Ability to communicate at all levels of an organization crisply and effectively, from senior executives on down, and across all functions, from business to technical, and across multiple geographies
    Location near a major airport and a willingness to travel to and work on-site at customer locations (as the position does require approximately 25% travel)
  
    Preferred candidates would also demonstrate these skills and qualifications:
  
   2+ years’ experience in deploying, testing and/or designing enterprise solutions using Microsoft Endpoint Manager, SCCM, Windows, Azure Active Directory, Office Web/Mobile, and related technologies
    Knowledge of the MDM (Mobile Device Management) and MAM (Mobile Application Management) spaces, including Windows, iOS, Mac and Android management
  
   Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:
    Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
  
    Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
  
  
  
    Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Note: Google’s hybrid workplace includes remote and in-office roles. By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:
  In-office locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA.
  Remote location(s): United States.
   Minimum qualifications:
   Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 
   5 years of experience in Operations, Strategy, or Product Operations roles, building relationships and leading operational initiatives.
   Preferred qualifications:
   Experience in stakeholder management. 
   Experience in Strategic or Annual Planning for large organizations. 
   Experience in management or operations consulting and managing/interpreting various stakeholder and team member expectations. 
   Ability to create effective relationships, influence, and collaborate at all organizational levels and with various cross-functional partners (e.g., Google Cloud, Finance, HR) without direct authority. 
   Ability to work in ambiguity and manage changing priorities. 
   Excellent written and verbal communication, problem-solving, strategic, and analytical skills and excellent business acumen. 
  
   About the job
    As an Operations member within the Collaboration and Communication (C&C) Strategy and Operations team, you will work closely with executive leadership and their management teams to help them effectively run their team and business. You will work cross-functionally for strategic and operational efforts that impact the organization (e.g., leading and contributing to the vision, strategy creation process, narrative development, etc.). 
   You’ll ensure effective communication, alignment, and execution of the organization’s strategy and roadmap. 
   Additional Information 
   
     (Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
    Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.
    
  
  
    Responsibilities
   Establish and optimize operating processes to effectively manage the organization by partnering closely across multiple functions simultaneously. Use cross-functional knowledge to understand issues, trends, and perspectives that may influence partners and work. 
    Manage annual strategic/business planning processes in coordination with your team and key partners. Facilitate communication and decision-making with leaders and teams within Google Cloud and across Google. 
    Partner with Finance, People Operations, Communications, Product Leads, and other cross-functional stakeholders to effectively allocate and manage headcount and related costs to ensure people/project reporting is maintained. 
    Lead and support critical projects based on emergent business needs. Structure and execute analyses required to develop recommendations and communicate findings to the leadership team and the organization. 
    Enable organization wide execution of initiatives and manage leadership expectations. 
   Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

GSS - Technology Product Management, is responsible for overseeing all technology platforms for Global Supplier Services businesses which include Sourcing & Procurement and Third Party Operations and Controls. The existing product suite that supports these businesses vary in terms of development and hosting models including everything from internally developed software hosted on JPMC infrastructure to Software as a Service hosted in third party cloud providers. These include products related to supplier selection (e.g. Ariba), supplier payment (e.g. SAP), supplier risk management (e.g. COMPASS and 4Site), contingent labor management (i.e. Beeline), employee expense management (e.g. Concur and smartApproval) and others. This organization must maintain a service oriented relationship with key leaders and stakeholders in GSS to ensure the technology platforms serve their needs and are properly maintained. The Technology Product Management team sets the strategic direction for the GSS technology roadmap and is staffed with product managers responsible for one or a collection of products. The team captures business requirements from end users, collaborate closely with design, and partners with software engineers to manage the entire life cycle for all GSS technology products. The team is also responsible for product innovation, product positioning, business case, product experience, and go-to-market strategies. 
  Responsibilities: 
  Define and execute a product vision & roadmap focused on data integration and analytics capabilities 
   Design and partner with SMEs and Technology to build a product to track emerging Supplier threats and enable self-service data discovery 
   Lead a cross-functional team of developers, design, and stakeholders to focus on the right things to build 
   Find and define the root problem motivating feature requests you'll receive 
   Ability to prioritize well, communicate clearly and understand how to drive a high level of focus and excellence with a strong, talented, opinionated team 
   Develop strategies to support product vision and map strategic path forward in a product roadmap 
   Evangelize the product roadmap throughout the organization 
   Be the expert on the users through developed empathy gathered through user research 
   Be the expert on the product and able to answer the toughest questions about how it works 
   Develop mock-ups to illustrate designs to stakeholders and dev 
   Develop prototypes to test designs on users 
   Decompose features into discrete user stories 
   Serve as Product Owner to one of our engineering scrum teams 
   Prepare organization for upcoming releases through giving demos and providing training to customer support team 
   Review emerging trends in issues gathered from customer support 
   Monitor KPI performance and outcomes of new features 
  Qualifications: 
  Bachelor's Degree with 3-5+ years experience in software Product Management 
   Experience as Product Owner in SCRUM team 
   Demonstrated ability to conduct data analysis, deliver actionable insights, and work directly with stakeholders to implement and measure recommended actions 
   Strong working knowledge of Big Data and Machine Learning capabilities 
   Development tracking tools (Confluence and JIRA) 
   Mock-up and prototyping tools (i.e. using Basalmiq, Sketch, Invision, Axure...) 
   You can explain something complex to a novice 
   You are comfortable presenting to a large crowd 
   You can lead a meeting with a diverse and opinionated group of participants 
   You are highly organized 
   You are mission-driven 
   You know how to listen deeply and know where to explore deeper 
   You are persuasive and know how to influence where you have no authority 
   You leave no stone unturned in your analytical thinking

AHP IT Product Manager to apply text AHPIPM to 978-226-6955
Advocates for Human Potential is seeking an IT Product Manager to support product strategy and delivery on digital platforms for Federal and State clients. AHP is experiencing unprecedented growth in data-driven projects reshaping behavioral healthcare delivery in the United States and we need an individual who can support the Senior IT Product Manager in managing multiple project teams to develop effective and efficient Cloud applications. The successful candidate will have experience coordinating technical products, facilitating contributions from disciplines across the company, and producing final technical deliverables. This role will support the translation of subject matter expert business goals and needs into user stories and product features by working with the design, programming, and data science teams to convert single project successes into standard enterprise offerings.
Key Roles & Responsibilities
Work with external and internal clients to define new technology products and operational plans
Identify features and define a backlog of user stories with acceptance criteria
Manage design and development teams
Validate that the solutions developed meet the acceptance criteria
Use metrics and data to measure success and plan improvements
Build out the AHP technology catalog to support AHP’s strategic plan to drive company-wide growth opportunities
Preferred Skills/Prerequisites
Experience managing a portfolio of concurrent products at different stages of development
Experience working on client-facing projects to define, document, and prioritize products and operational plans
Excellent communication, organization, and time management skills
Experience delivering public-facing, data-intensive web applications
Experience with product management, human-centered design, and agile development
Ability to translate qualitative and quantitative feedback into product requirements
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree, 2 to 4 years experience in the related field. A Master’s Degree is a plus
About AHP
AHP influences change in health and business systems to support vulnerable populations—from creating policy to ground-level, hands-on work. We help organizations and individuals reach their full potential through professional consulting; research, evaluation, and data analytics; technical assistance and training; and virtual solutions, publications, and events.
Our areas of expertise include behavioral health policy and services, substance use disorders, co-occurring disorders, medication-assisted treatment, recovery support services, workforce development, homelessness, permanent supportive housing and employment, trauma-informed care, criminal justice, women and children, veterans, youth, health information technology, and population health management.
AHP is an equal opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or protected veteran status.
